Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

Omio’s vision is to enable people to travel seamlessly anywhere, anyway. We are bringing all global transport into a single distribution system and creating end-to-end magical consumer journeys.

With Omio you can compare and book trains, buses, ferries and flights anywhere in Europe, the US, and Canada with one simple search, on mobile, app or desktop. By offering transparent pricing and easy booking, Omio makes travel planning simple, flexible and personal.

Omio is the largest source of inventory, with 1000+ suppliers operating in 39 countries. Our brands also include Rome2Rio for global discovery, while Omio powers ticketing and journeys, which attract 900m+ users every year. Our offices are based in Berlin, Prague, Melbourne, Brazil, Bangalore, and London.

We are a growing team of more than 400 passionate employees from more than 50 countries who share the same vision: to create a single tool to help send travellers almost anywhere in the world.

Job Description

The Commercial Analytics team’s primary responsibility is in the integration, measurement and optimisation of our travel inventory. Working with hundreds of travel providers across many thousands of routes, the team ensures we have the options our customers need.

The team collaborates closely across the business, particularly with our commercial, product, and finance functions, and has a significant impact on setting and delivering on our strategic priorities relating to expanding our global inventory. The team also has responsibilities in supporting our B2B business and working with finance on Payments and Fraud operations, but this role is very focused on global inventory.

Main Tasks & Responsibilities


Understand Omio’s business model, particularly around the supply of travel inventory across the globe.
Understand and lead on establishing Omio’s top-line metrics and KPIs, reporting their evolution, detecting anomalies, evaluating key drivers, and diagnosing issue root causes.
Build dashboards to support efficient dissemination of the above trends
Work alongside the commercial team to draw insights on the performance of key commercial metrics related to inventory, funnel conversions, bookings, basket size, take rates, etc. across markets
Build forecasting models to understand gaps in current performance and sales/revenue optimization models to enhance margins without negatively impacting user experience
Perform statistical analyses - including A/B tests and pre/post analyses
Correlate marketing/product/commercial data to derive key insights
Work with our data engineering/business intelligence teams to build data models, which best summarise and utilise our production data
Spot, highlight, and initiate actions on emerging and existing risks related to liabilities and open positions with customers (for example, cancellation liabilities, commission risk, etc.)
Act as an advocate of our company’s data-driven culture: produce reports that are actionable, dashboards that are diagnostic, and recommendations that drive growth


Qualifications

Qualifications:


University degree in Business, Engineering, Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or a similar field; 3+ years of relevant work experience, preferably in e-commerce, consultancy or banking/finance.
Passionate about working with numbers; excellent analytical skills, confidence in working with large data sets and expert in SQL and Excel/Google sheets (R/Python is a plus)
Fluent in English; additional languages are always valued at Omio


Additional Information

What’s in it for you?


Have an impact. With innovation and smart technology, we are changing the way people travel, and you too can have an impact on this ride
A competitive and attractive compensation package
Subsidized Urban Sports Club membership
A diverse team of more than 45 nationalities


Diversity makes us stronger

We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, age or disability.

Hiring process and background checks

At Omio, we work in partnership with Giant Screening, once a job offer has been accepted, Giant will be engaged to carry out background screening. Giant will reach out to you via email and occasionally via telephone/text message so that they can gather all the relevant information required. Consent will be requested prior to any information being passed to our services company.

Recruitment scams: Important notice

Protect yourself from scammers, Omio wants to ensure your ongoing safety during the application process at Omio. Please keep in mind potential scammers impersonating Omio recruiters (mainly via a global professional networking site, and messenger app's).

Remember, Omio never requests payment or sensitive personal information during the recruitment process. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to recruitment@omio.com. Remember to cross-reference against our careers page if you question the authenticity, stay vigilant, and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

Intrigued? Apply here in English.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role Description This is a part-time remote role for a Data Analyst at The Recruitmentt Hub. The Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing data, interpreting trends, and providing insights to support business decision-making. The role involves conducting statistical analysis, data modeling, and communicating findings to stakeholders. Qualifications Analytical Skills, Data Analytics, and Statistics abilities Strong Communication skills Data Modeling proficiency Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Description

Data Analyst (m/f/d)

THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.

THE ROLE We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our innovative and international Data & Insights team. By understanding the data needs of our stakeholders, you'll provide valuable insights and clear recommendations to support our data-driven decision-making process.

What You'll Do


Dive into complex marketing data sets to uncover trends and insights that drive key business decisions. Your work will have a direct impact on the strategy and growth of our group companies
Collaborate with a forward-thinking team that embraces the latest technologies and methodologies. We believe in continuous learning and innovation
Partner closely with team members and external business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making


Requirements

WHAT YOU'LL BRING


At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficient in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Marketing Data and Analytics, as well as Retail Media and Customer Analytics would be a big plus
Familiarity with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Strong abilities in generating reports using data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact
Fluent in German and English


What We Offer


Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child’s sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
In house conversational German classes for beginners
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Premium relocation support for colleagues outside of Germany: visa application support, assistance with searching temporary accommodation, payment of the first monthly rent
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners
Show more

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Insights Analyst

Location: Hybrid – Frankfurt, Berlin, Hamburg, Mannheim.

Salary: €50,000 - €60,000 per annum




Company Overview: Join a rapidly expanding data analytics strategy division, supporting over 55 entertainment venues across the UK. They drive operational efficiency and inform strategic decisions through advanced data analytics. Their mission is to ensure seamless operations and enhance performance at major events by delivering actionable insights to the operations and finance teams.




Role Purpose: As an Insights Analyst, you will support our data-driven decision-making process across our venues in Germany and the Netherlands. Your primary focus will be on building and utilizing data to optimize business operations.




Responsibilities:

Build and manage data analytics for 6 venues in Germany and 1 in the Netherlands.
Develop and deliver insights to improve operational efficiency and support business optimization.
Visit venues regularly to oversee data implementation and provide on-site support.
Align data analytics with financial and operational strategies, ensuring cohesive execution.
Utilize tools such as Power BI to generate and present data-driven insights.
Collaborate with non-data stakeholders, participating in quarterly meetings and senior-level discussions.
Travel as required to support the needs of various venues and stakeholders.

Must-Have Qualifications:

Proficiency in data analytics tools such as Power BI, Amazon QuikSight, Tableau, Qlik Sense.
Experience in using data to improve real-world operations, mostly in service industry such as retail, factories or sport venues.
Fluency in both German and English.

Desired Qualifications:

Strong communication skills, comfortable engaging with stakeholders at all levels.
Willingness to travel regularly to different venues.
Experience presenting data to non-technical audiences.

Title: Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Your role

We are seeking a curious and versatile Data Analyst who has strong SQL skills and has worked with Tableau to join our team of seven data professionals. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional analytical and problem solving skills, as well as solid communication skills enabling them to share analytical insights effectively with business stakeholders from marketing, operations and the executive layer. The person in this role will serve as a trusted advisor to the stakeholders and contribute to the overall health and quality of the data platform.


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data analysis tasks
Design and participate in the modelling of KPIs
Advise on and come up with performance indicators and proxies for visualisation of the success of different teams
Work with stakeholders to support them navigate the Data environment, understand and work with the reports relevant to them
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business outcomes
Create, verify and maintain visualisations to effectively communicate insights
Suggest actions, based on the data insights and work with teams to develop their strategies


Your profile


Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Social Science or Statistics, with a solid track record as a Data Analyst and a strong emphasis on data manipulation
Proficiency in SQL, hands-on experience with Google Analytics, GTM, Google Ads, and event data, as well as knowledge of data warehousing (BigQuery) and architecture, is desirable!
Hands-on experience with Tableau; experience with dbt, GetKlar, and TimeSquare is a significant plus!
Understanding of classic e-commerce KPIs and metrics, with the ability to contextualize each data point in relation to others
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and extract actionable insights
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with familiarity in multi-cultural environments


What we offer


An appealing discount on all of our products – from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients
We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year
The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket
A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a flexible work model and 'workation'
Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia
You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas
Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world
We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day


Apply with your CV and cover letter via our application portal. To show us that you've read the entire job ad, please include the phrase 'YES, I AM SUNDAY'S NEW TEAM MEMBER' in the first sentence of your cover letter.

Contact

Sabrina Thome

Apply for this job

About Us

Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy – as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations.

We take our ecological responsibility very seriously: Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable.

We have a diverse team of 190 people and 37 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues.

We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don’t match with 100% of the requirements.

Title: Data Analyst with a focus on Power BI
Description:
Our Berlin and Munich offices are expanding! Do you want to be our future data colleague?

Data is one of Solita’s four areas of expertise. We have more than 400 data specialists, and our knowledge portfolio contains a variety of data-related specializations involving data solutions in a lot of technologies, both in the cloud and otherwise. In Solita, you will be part of a team that is courageous and passionate, but at the same time easy-going.

As the German market is a cornerstone of our growth strategy in West Europe, we are strengthening our German team with new Data colleagues. You will be working in our Berlin or Munich offices (Hybrid of course) where everything is in place to make your working day meaningful: coffee chats, office dogs, and apéro with colleagues at the end of the day.

Where Your Expertise Is Needed


Rollout Power BI Service as data visualization solution
Setting up, configure and maintain Power BI Service (e.g. Workspaces, Access Control, Data Sources Connectivity)
Building semantic models for reports and dashboards
Building data visualizations
Guiding clients on their digital transformation journey towards cloud native data visualization



What We Are Looking For


Expert in end-to-end Power BI Service ownership (setup, rollout, maintain, utilize)
Expert expertise in SQL, DAX and M
Expert in data modelling (semantic modelling) in Power BI
Native in German and good English knowledge



What We Offer


Challenging, impactful projects to work with
Nordic work culture of trust, responsibility, and maximum freedom
Individual benefit packages that suit your personal needs
Learning and career growth opportunities
A Scandinavian company culture mixed with German culture: read more



We believe the diversity of ideas and backgrounds gives us the creativity to be successful in a rapidly changing world. In support of this, we stress equality of opportunity for all qualified individuals in accordance with applicable laws. Decisions on hiring, promotion, development, compensation, or advancement are based solely on a person’s qualifications, abilities, experience, and performance.

Interested in hearing more?

We want to hear from you and figure out together what works best for us both. Tell us about yourself and your background in your own words.  Unfortunately, currently we cannot offer relocation for candidates outside Europe.

Our recruitment consists of 3 rounds of interviews where you will meet our team and learn more about working at Solita.

If you would like to hear more about working at Solita, please contact our recruiter Pauline Roy-Malikian: pauline.roy-malikian@solita.be

Title: Data Analyst/Market Researcher
Description:
Job Description

Responsibilities:


Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscapes, and growth opportunities.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights and inform business decisions.
Develop and maintain comprehensive databases and dashboards to track key performance indicators and metrics.
Generate reports, presentations, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategies and initiatives based on research findings.
Stay current on market developments, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and market research.


Requirements:


Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
Proven experience as a data analyst, market researcher, or similar role, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.


What We Offer:


Competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance and retirement savings options.
Flexible work schedule and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the United States.
Professional development opportunities, including training and certifications to support your career growth.
A supportive and collaborative team environment where your contributions are valued and recognized.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Intro

You love travelling and are you ready for new challenges in an ambitious, fast-growing and committed company? Then you've come to the right place!

Start Your Career With Us As

Data Analyst (m/w/x)

as of January

Your Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst (m/f/x) at Travelcircus, you will be responsible for managing and optimizing data products, fulfilling data requests, and overseeing self-service tools to ensure stakeholders have access to timely and accurate insights. You will design and maintain ETL pipelines, support web tracking systems and collaborate with the DevOps team to maintain infrastructure, including job scheduling and database management. This full-time position is based in our vibrant office in Berlin.

Things you will work on

In the role of Data Analyst at Travelcircus, you will be responsible for the following topics:


Data Product Management: Manage and optimize data products to satisfy stakeholder needs and adapt to changes in underlying data sources.
Data Request Fulfillment: Fulfill internal and external data requests, providing timely and accurate insights to drive decision-making.
Self-Service Tools Management: Oversee the management of self-service dashboards and reporting tools, ensuring stakeholders can access and analyze data independently.
ETL Pipeline Development: Design, create, and maintain ETL pipelines to ensure smooth data integration and processing across the organization.
Web Tracking Support: Support the maintenance and optimization of web tracking setups, including Google Tag Manager (GTM), Google Analytics 4 (GA4), and BigQuery.
Infrastructure Maintenance: Collaborate with the DevOps team to maintain the underlying infrastructure, including job scheduling, and SQL/NoSQL databases.


What We Offer


FLEXIBLE WORKING HOURS thanks to part-time and flexitime models as well as remote work
ATTRACTIVE WORK ENVIRONMENT in a stylish loft office with start-up flair, cooking together, fun & cohesion in a varied working environment and regular team events
TRANSPARENT COMMUNICATION thanks to flat hierarchies, fixed feedback cycles and weekly company and team meetings
OPTIMAL CAREER OPPORTUNITIES thanks to a comprehensive onboarding programme and individual induction, continuous on-the-job training, optimal promotion and further development opportunities
ADDITIONAL COMPENSATION & DISCOUNT on BVG company ticket (public transport) and discounts with over 800 other providers
PERSONAL TRAVEL BUDGET of €1080 per year to spend freely on our entire product portfolio
WORK LIFE BALANCE with 28 days‘ holiday, increasing per year of service, with up to 35 days’ holiday
entitlement as well as company health management and a pension scheme


Your profile


You have 1+ years working experience as a Business Strategist, Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Scientist, Data Engineer or a related position
You have a degree in computer science, statistics, physics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar field
You have preferably but not necessarily worked in a tech or web-focussed company before
You are highly proficient in SQL and experienced with dashboarding tools (e.g. Metabase, Qlik, etc.)
You have programming experience in Python
You are highly results-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
You have strong communication skills and are comfortable interacting with a range of internal and external business stakeholders
Your English skills are excellent in both, writing and speaking
Ideally, you are experienced with DevOps tools (e.g. CI/CD pipelines, Docker, NoSQL/SQL database configuration)
Ideally, you are experienced with Apache Airflow or similar workflow management toools
Ideally, you are experienced with web tracking/analytics (e.g. Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, attribution modelling)


Do you still have questions or do you want to apply immediately?

If you want to develop yourself further and take on responsibility, then you've come to the right place. Please send us your application, including your salary expectations and your earliest possible start date, exclusively via our online application system.

Our people manager will be happy to answer any questions you may have:

Firuze Deligür

firuze.deliguer@travelcircus.de

+49 (0) 157 5099 9587

Team Travelcircus

Over the past few years, Travelcircus has developed into an internationally active company with over 100 highly motivated and committed employees who form the basis of our success.

If you would like to get to know our team, then take a look at our Instagram career page - there you will get a first impression of your future colleagues.

We expressly declare that we welcome everyone, regardless of gender, nationality or ethnic origin, religion or ideology, disability, age or sexual identity.

We look forward to getting to know you!

About Us

Travelcircus, the online booking platform for event travel experiences, was founded by Bastian Böckenhüser in Berlin in 2014. By combining internationally popular events (e.g. theme parks, musicals, exhibitions or concerts) with quality-tested premium hotels, Travelcircus puts together unique packages at attractive prices for its customers. Over 1 million travellers have trusted us since the company was founded.

Since the beginning of 2022, Travelcircus has entered other European markets in addition to the DACH markets. Dutch, Belgian, French, Italian, Spanish, Danish and British travellers can now also book the unique packages. Through the Travelking brand acquired in September 2022, Travelcircus is also represented in the Czech Republic, Hungary and Slovakia. True to the motto ‘by travellers for travellers’, the Travelcircus team shares a common vision of presenting the hottest events and most sought-after weekend destinations to travel enthusiasts online at the best value for money.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Help Experience
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

As our new Decision Scientist, you’ll become part of a cross-functional team in the Help Experience domain with a mission to enable an effortless, scalable and cost effective support experience for our Vinted members. Your team’s focus will be on supporting our Member Support function and enabling quality and efficiency improvements through automation, self-service, and operational excellence.

We’re looking for someone who is a strategic thinker, a problem solver, with a strong data background, who aims high. You like to work in a fast-changing environment, and you are passionate about the product we’re building together.

Next to the product team you will be part of the cross-domain Data Science & Analytics (DSA) guild where you will interact and learn from all data people in Vinted. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


You will report to the Director of Data Science & Analytics in Help Experience and work closely with other leaders in the domain, particularly in the data science & analytics and product functions.

In this position, you’ll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
Analyze identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)
Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests
Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses


About You


Demonstratable experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Product Analyst
BSc or MSc in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, or another related field (equivalent working experience is also acceptable)
Highly business-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Excellent written and spoken English
Are able to balance between analyses depth (time needed) and business impact
Ability to deal with uncertainty and to combine data insights with strategic thinking
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is €60,000 - €93,000 gross per year.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Digital Marketing
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

At Vinted, our Digital Marketing Data Science & Analytics team is pivotal in driving growth through data-driven decision-making and enabling high-stake investment decisions. This team comprises talented individuals with backgrounds in academia, econometrics, e-commerce, consulting, and media. They use scientific approaches to solve complex business problems, develop statistical and business models, perform advanced data analyses, and ensure data reliability.

Within Marketing, we currently have exciting opportunities for Decision Scientists to work with either CRM or Performance Marketing teams.

Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) department we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.


In this position, you’ll


Set up untracked marketing experiments: Use Geo experiments, causal impact, or diff-in-diff methodologies to measure the incremental impact of different marketing channels and campaigns
Experimentation: Analyse AB tests and iterate on the experiment set up and automated testing tools
Revenue Stream Analysis: Investigate revenue streams generated by marketing, including acquisition, reactivation, and engagement.
Marketing Channel Analysis: Assess the impact of various marketing channels on user acquisition, retention, engagement, and revenue.
Support Media Mix Modeling: Occasionally assist with ad-hoc requests, including data questions, consultations, and analyses.
Segmentation: Develop unique personas to enable relevant and personalised comms to millions of Vinted users
Analytical deep dives: answer complex questions such as: when is the best time to reach out to our customers? What is the best mix of different messages and amount of communications? What is the total impact of all communications?


About You

General Requirements:


Several years of experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role.
Strong business results orientation with the ability to connect scientific approaches with pragmatic problem-solving.
Excellent communication skills to present results persuasively to various stakeholders.
Proficiency in at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Stata, Matlab, etc.)
Fluency in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau).
A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business, or a related field.
Excellent written and spoken English.


Nice To Have Skills (not All Necessary)


Strong experimentation knowledge from CRM or Product background;
Good understanding of performance marketing channels attribution;
Causal inference and geo experimentation experience


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 57,000 - € 77,100 gross per year.

  • Set up untracked marketing experiments: Use Geo experiments, causal impact, or diff-in-diff methodologies to measure the incremental impact of different marketing channels and campaigns
  • Experimentation: Analyse AB tests and iterate on the experiment set up and automated testing tools
  • Revenue Stream Analysis: Investigate revenue streams generated by marketing, including acquisition, reactivation, and engagement.
  • Marketing Channel Analysis: Assess the impact of various marketing channels on user acquisition, retention, engagement, and revenue.
  • Support Media Mix Modeling: Occasionally assist with ad-hoc requests, including data questions, consultations, and analyses.
  • Segmentation: Develop unique personas to enable relevant and personalised comms to millions of Vinted users
  • Analytical deep dives: answer complex questions such as: when is the best time to reach out to our customers? What is the best mix of different messages and amount of communications? What is the total impact of all communications?

About You

General Requirements:

  • Several years of experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role.
  • Strong business results orientation with the ability to connect scientific approaches with pragmatic problem-solving.
  • Excellent communication skills to present results persuasively to various stakeholders.
  • Proficiency in at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Stata, Matlab, etc.)
  • Fluency in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau).
  • A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business, or a related field.
  • Excellent written and spoken English.

Nice To Have Skills (not All Necessary)

  • Strong experimentation knowledge from CRM or Product background;
  • Good understanding of performance marketing channels attribution;
  • Causal inference and geo experimentation experience

Work perks

  • The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
  • 30 days of paid annual leave
  • Newest MacBook models
  • Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
  • Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
  • A daily lunch allowance
  • Frequent team-building events
  • A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
  • A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
  • A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
  • Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
  • Life and disability insurance provided
  • A subsidised Deutschlandticket
  • The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
  • A dog-friendly office

Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 57,000 - € 77,100 gross per year.

Title: Working Student Data Analyst (x/f/m)
Description:
As a Working Student Data Analyst (F/X/M), you have a unique opportunity to revolutionize the financial industry. With our platform Pulsproject we enable SMEs to get business loans without the hassle of a complicated bank check. In our highly dedicated and motivated team, you will analyze our customer data. Join our team in Berlin and start your career at a young and dynamic FinTech company.

Tasks


Data collection and cleansing: Collect, cleanse, and organize data from multiple sources to ensure data quality and completeness.
Data analysis: Analyze data using data analysis tools to identify trends, patterns, and outliers.
Data Interpretation: understandably interpret results and provide clear recommendations for action to team members and customers.
Quality Assurance: Perform data quality checks and validations to ensure data integrity.


Requirements


You are currently studying for a Bachelor's (last year) or Master's degree in the field of Computer science / Finance / Business Analytics in Berlin.
Proficiency with data analysis tools and software such as Excel.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and find creative solutions.
Fluent in written and spoken English, with German language skills rounding out the profile.
Attention to detail and commitment to high-quality work.
Ability to work as part of a team and adapt to changing priorities.


Benefits


Learn from a incredibly talented team of smart, international individuals who are always ready to learn, discover, and implement
An environment that offers room for personal and professional development
A centrally located office in Berlin City West
Being part of a fearless pioneering company that relentlessly strives for new technological breakthroughs
The opportunity to work with smart and passionate people to develop fantastic products
A pet-friendly environment
Salary progression based on length of service with the company
Challenging projects. Exceptional experiences.


At Puls Technologies GmbH, we're not just offering a job; we're inviting you to be part of an exhilarating expedition that is reshaping the very fabric of the SME landscape. If you're passionate about driving growth, igniting innovation, and leaving a lasting impact, your adventure begins here!

You will work with an enthusiastic team of smart, talented people in the heart of Berlin's City West.

Get in touch with us now!

Puls Technologies GmbH

Title: Social Media Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Daten über das Social Media Verhalten deiner Zielgruppe faszinieren dich? Du liebst es, aus einer großen, ungeordneten Menge an Zahlen, konkrete Schlüsse zu ziehen und dein gewonnenes Wissen für andere verständlich zu machen? Du bist außerdem detailverliebt und hast Lust neue Prozesse mitzugestalten?

Dann sucht unser Team Dich! Als Social Media Analyst (w/m/d).

Bewirb Dich! Auch wenn das Profil auf den ersten Blick nicht zu 100% passt.




Was erwartet dich

Auswertung und Analyse von Performance-Daten auf allen relevanten Social-Media-Kanälen
Nutzung von Analyse-Tools (Sprinklr, Google Analytics, Google Looker Studio etc.)
Ableiten und Präsentieren von relevanten Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen
Optimierung/Automatisierung von Datenverarbeitung und Prozessen
Visuelle Datenaufbereitung & Dashboarding
Unterstützung von interdisziplinären Projektteams
Die Chance, mit einer der weltweit führenden Automobilmarken zu arbeiten




Was bringst du mit

Expertise im Bereich Social Media Analytics, zusätzliche Kenntnisse in Social-Media-Strategie und Advertising
Ein Gespür für Zahlen
Kompetenz im Umgang mit den aktuell relevanten Social-Media-Netzwerken
Fähigkeit zum Aufbau vertrauensvoller Kund:innenbeziehungen
Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office und eine unbändige Excel-Leidenschaft
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Interesse an der Automobilbranche ist von Vorteil




Wer wir sind

Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 200 sehr guten Leuten an unserem Standort in Berlin-Kreuzberg.

Autonomie, Vertrauen und Gestaltungsspielraum sind unsere Vision der modernen Arbeitswelt von morgen.
Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig und glauben an die kulturstiftende Wirkung von regelmäßigen Teamevents zur beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung.
Diversity, Gleichberechtigung sowie eine gesunde Work-Life Balance gehören zu unseren wichtigsten Werten.
Unser transparenter Feedbackprozess trägt bei uns zu einer offenen und wertschätzenden Kommunikationskultur bei.
Wir wollen zu deinem Leben passen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Work-Life-Care-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts an.




Was wir bieten

Hybrides Arbeitszeitmodell mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Regelmäßige Teamevents
Bis zu vier Wochen im Jahr im EU-Ausland arbeiten
30 Urlaubstage für alle Mitarbeiter:innen
Unbefristeter Vertrag nach 6-monatiger Probezeit
Raum zur Entfaltung und zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten in deiner neuen Rolle
Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget mit individuellem Gestaltungsspielraum




Wir freuen uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins an talent@tlgg.de.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
We are a mobile game company, based in both Helsinki and Berlin, creating world-class entertainment by building a portfolio of hit games. Since our launch in 2020, our first chart-topping game Merge Mansion has been entertaining over 55 million players worldwide, and we have grown into a team of over 200.

Our mission is to entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, with our games, and also through our creative marketing, community, and beyond – while having fun with it.

We’re ordinary people crafting extraordinary games with passion and ambition, united by our culture of trust, psychological safety and wellbeing.

We are looking for an innovative Data Analyst to help us understand the performance of our marketing activities and how to optimize them to improve our business. You will join the Business & Growth team, ensuring we make data-driven decisions that maximize ROI and drive business growth.

More about Metacore crafts: https://metacoregames.com/our-crafts

Responsibilities


Analyzing data for competitive advantages and flagging underperforming sources and tactics
Understanding what makes creative content successful
Supporting the marketing team in fully utilizing new attribution methods and models to determine the contribution of different activities
Ensuring quality and consistency of data, predictions, and targets
Building and maintaining reports and data models that assist in evaluating campaign and creative performance, allocating budgets, and setting targets



Requirements


A keen interest in staying up-to-date with the latest trends in the User Acquisition landscape
Knowledge of MMP, SKAN, and Google Privacy Sandbox
Extensive experience with data, either in gaming or digital marketing
Technical know-how in:
SQL at scale (Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift)
Python, R, or Julia
Looker, Tableau, or equivalent visualization tool



In addition to these, it would be nice but not mandatory for you to have some of these as well:


Past work experience in F2P mobile gaming business
Familiarity with:
Data modeling and transformation with tools such as dbt
Version control using Git

Statistics or ML experience with skewed distributions, such as ROAS modeling


What We Offer


Workplace where we aim high, without taking ourselves too seriously
Autonomy and accountability with support to foster professional development
Great opportunities to grow with the company
Work-life balance and strong emphasis on wellbeing
Approachable leaders with low ego
Flexible hybrid workplace where people enjoy working at the office



Basics


Location: Helsinki, Finland or Berlin, Germany
Relocation: Relocating to Finland or Germany expected, full support provided
Work model: Mix of office and remote work
Working language: English



Our equal opportunity statement

To entertain hundreds of millions of people for decades, we need diverse teams that understand our diverse audiences. The key to unleash our creativity is a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture of trust where Metacoreans from all walks of life can be themselves. We celebrate our differences and believe they are the strength that drives us forward.

We are committed to offering equal opportunities for all, regardless of background, age, race, color, ethnicity, religion, disability, gender, sexual orientation, family status, education, socioeconomic status or any other characteristic. We build and maintain a workplace and industry free of harassment and discrimination.

We also aspire to have DE&I as a fundamental part of our game design process to enable us to create even better and more inclusive games, communities and entertainment.

If you require any support or have specific needs during the application process, please don't hesitate to let us know. We look forward to hearing from you!

Our culture

Our culture is based on trust, psychological safety and wellbeing. At Metacore, autonomy and accountability go firmly hand in hand, and we cultivate a diverse and inclusive workplace where you can be yourself.

We are collaborative and humble, and think “we” before “me”. We enable focus through transparency and ownership. We aim high, and aspire to be nothing less than the best game company in the world to work for.

To create even better games, communities and entertainment, we welcome talent with diverse experiences, who are passionate about their roles and bold in their ambition.

We have collectively defined our culture and values, and we uphold them together, every day.

Read more about our culture: https://metacoregames.com/culture
Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Description

Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)

THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.

THE ROLE As a Senior Data Analyst at Oetker Digital, you will play a critical role in owning and leveraging data to drive business decisions and strategies. You will work closely with various teams and business partners on the side of our Group companies to ask the right questions, deeply understand the business domains and processes, analyze datasets, generate insights and business cases based on data that help our brands grow and succeed in the digital space. Your expertise will guide the optimization of brand, marketing and sales strategies, product development, and customer engagement initiatives.

What You'll Do


Partner and collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their strategies, needs and objectives
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key business partners to ensure data solutions align with business goals
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Analyze datasets to extract actionable insights and support data-driven decision making
Develop and implement statistical models to solve complex business problems
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights through effective data storytelling


Requirements

WHAT YOU'LL BRING


At least 5 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
Experience in Marketing Analytics & Optimization
You like to learn, work hands-on, take ownership, and have an impact
Fluent in German and English


What We Offer


Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child’s sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners
Show more

Title: Data / BI Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Firmenprofil Für meinen Kunden, einem Beratungsunternehmen in der Gesundheitsbranche, suche ich einenData/BI-Analysten (m/w/d) mit tiefergehenden Kenntnissen im Bereich SQL. In dieser Position übernimmst du Datenanalysen, erstellst Berichte mit modernen Tools wie Power BI, optimierst die Datenstruktur und -qualität und arbeitest an Projekten zur Anbindung und Anpassung von Datenquellen. Aufgabengebiet Durchführung von Datenauswertungen und Erstellung von Berichten mit Power BI Ermittlung und Bereitstellung strategischer und operativer Kennzahlen Beratung der Mitarbeitenden zu Qualitätsprüfungen und Kennzahlen Analyse und Optimierung der Datenstruktur und -qualität Sicherstellung reibungsloser Datenverarbeitung und eigenständige Qualitätsprüfungen Anforderungsprofil Abgeschlossenes Studium mit quantitativen Inhalten (Informatik, Ingenieurs-, Sozial- oder Wirtschaftswissenschaften bevorzugt) Teamorientierte Person mit starkem IT-Interesse Erfahrung in Datenbanksystemen (z.B. SQL) und Abfragetechniken Kenntnisse im BI-Bereich, idealerweise mit Reporting-Tools (z.B. Power BI, Tableau) Analytisches Denkvermögen, Begeisterung für Datenanalysen und ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten Vergütungspaket Anspruchsvolle Tätigkeit in einer zukunftsorientierten Branche mit unbefristetem Vertrag Arbeit in einem kreativen, dienstleistungsorientierten Team mit offener Kommunikation Hoher Gestaltungsfreiraum und Eigenverantwortung im Arbeitsalltag Individuelle Einarbeitung durch erfahrene Mentoren und moderne Technologien Familienfreundliche Arbeitsbedingungen mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, 33 Urlaubstagen und attraktiven Zusatzleistungen (TV MD, Weihnachtsgeld, betriebliche Altersvorsorge)

In dieser Position übernimmst du Datenanalysen, erstellst Berichte mit modernen Tools wie Power BI, optimierst die Datenstruktur und -qualität und arbeitest an Projekten zur Anbindung und Anpassung von Datenquellen. Aufgabengebiet Durchführung von Datenauswertungen und Erstellung von Berichten mit Power BI Ermittlung und Bereitstellung strategischer und operativer Kennzahlen Beratung der Mitarbeitenden zu Qualitätsprüfungen und Kennzahlen Analyse und Optimierung der Datenstruktur und -qualität Sicherstellung reibungsloser Datenverarbeitung und eigenständige Qualitätsprüfungen Anforderungsprofil Abgeschlossenes Studium mit quantitativen Inhalten (Informatik, Ingenieurs-, Sozial- oder Wirtschaftswissenschaften bevorzugt) Teamorientierte Person mit starkem IT-Interesse Erfahrung in Datenbanksystemen (z.B. SQL) und Abfragetechniken Kenntnisse im BI-Bereich, idealerweise mit Reporting-Tools (z.B. Power BI, Tableau) Analytisches Denkvermögen, Begeisterung für Datenanalysen und ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten Vergütungspaket Anspruchsvolle Tätigkeit in einer zukunftsorientierten Branche mit unbefristetem Vertrag Arbeit in einem kreativen, dienstleistungsorientierten Team mit offener Kommunikation Hoher Gestaltungsfreiraum und Eigenverantwortung im Arbeitsalltag Individuelle Einarbeitung durch erfahrene Mentoren und moderne Technologien Familienfreundliche Arbeitsbedingungen mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, 33 Urlaubstagen und attraktiven Zusatzleistungen (TV MD, Weihnachtsgeld, betriebliche Altersvorsorge)

Title: Data Analyst*in
Description:
Data Analyst*in (m/w/d)

DKB AG

Standort: Berlin

unbefristet

Teil- & Vollzeit möglich

ab sofort

Deine Aufgaben


Du arbeitest im Bereich Business Intelligence in einem interdisziplinären Team von Expert*innen und versorgst dort als Data Analyst*in die Facheinheiten der Banksteuerung mit relevanten Daten und Insights
Du bist Sparringspartner*in für den*die Product Owner*in und führst Workshops zur Auftragsklärung und Anforderungsspezifikation durch
Du analysierst DKB-interne und externe Datenquellen und definierst fachliche Regeln und Rahmenbedingungen für eine Datenintegration
Du schlägst die Brücke zwischen Anforderungen aus dem Business und der technischen Implementierung, begleitest die Umsetzung und testest neue Artefakte auf Herz und Niere
Du kooperierst eng mit unseren Data Engineers und mit Expert*innen zu den Themen Datenarchitektur, Datenmodellierung, Data Governance, Datenqualität und Datenschutz
Du führst Datenanalysen durch und unterstützt deine Stakeholder bei der Entscheidungsfindung
Du nutzt einen modernen Toolstack und arbeitest in einem agilen Setup
Du bringst dich aktiv in unsere Data Analyst Community ein, teilst dein Wissen und bleibst immer up to date


Dein Profil


Du hast deinen Bachelor oder Master in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, (Wirtschafts-)Mathematik oder einem vergleichbaren quantitativen Studiengang in der Tasche und bringst bereits relevante Berufserfahrung als Data Analyst*in mit
Mit deinen Erfahrungen im Anforderungsmanagement kannst du komplexe Aufgaben verstehen, priorisieren und sie im Team lösen
Du weißt, wie eine Bank funktioniert und gesteuert wird und es interessiert dich, wie ihre Bereiche mit den für sie relevanten Daten versorgt werden
Kenntnisse in SQL, Python, BI Tools und Datenvisualisierung bringst du mit
Analytisch-ganzheitliche Denkweise und Stakeholdermanagement gehören zu deinen Stärken
Data Vault und 3NF sowie Jira und Confluence sind keine Fremdwörter für dich


Die DKB steht für Vielfalt und Chancengerechtigkeit. Egal, woher du kommst, wie alt du bist, welches Geschlecht, welche Genderidentität, sexuelle Orientierung oder Religion du hast, ob mit oder ohne Behinderung - wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Deine Benefits und mehr


Attraktive Vergütung (tariflich oder außertariflich)
Flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten – temporär auch im EU-Ausland
Du hast die Wahl: Benefits Pass, Jobticket oder Jobrad
Moderne Technik- ausstattung und Tool Stack.
Individuelle Qualifi- zierungsmöglichkeiten
Duz-Kultur und kein Dresscode
Externe Mitarbeitenden- beratung
Angebote zum Gesundbleiben
Weitere Extras wie z.B. betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Versicherungsschutz


Immer für dich ansprechbar

Kristina Fink

Expertise Lead

recruiting@dkb.de

Deutsche Kreditbank AG

Du möchtest mehr zur DKB erfahren?

Dann schau auf unserer Karriereseite vorbei.

Title: Data analyst (m/f/d) for the development and maintenance of reporting tools in asset management
Description:
Data Analyst (m/f/d) for the development and maintenance of reporting tools in asset management

Fancy exciting data projects? You can have it!

We Are Looking For Immediately

Data Analyst (m/f/d) for the development and maintenance of reporting tools in Asset Management in Munich

We are currently looking for: Data Analyst (m/f/d) for the development and maintenance of reporting tools in Asset Management

Our client is one of Germany's leading IT service providers with over 2,500 employees at more than 26 locations. As an owner-managed and independent system house, the company supplies both private-sector customers from all industries and public-sector clients with high-quality IT solutions. Our client combines high-quality IT products from leading manufacturers with its extensive project expertise, broad range of services and flexibility in order to develop solutions that are optimally tailored to the customer.

Your future area of responsibility

Role

As an independent developer and optimizer of reporting tools, you will play a key role in our company. Your tasks will include:


Development and optimization of reporting tools: You will be responsible for independently developing and continuously improving our reporting tools to deliver a world-class experience to our internal and external customers.
Project responsibility: You take responsibility for work packages and deadlines in projects and help to ensure that our products always meet the future requirements of the financial industry.
Consulting and collaboration: You analyze our customers' requirements and work with them to develop viable solutions. Your in-depth knowledge and solution-oriented approach make you a valued point of contact.
Operations and ITIL processes: You ensure the optimization and safeguarding of operations, successfully implementing ITIL processes such as change, incident and service management. You will also be responsible for creating and updating IT system documentation.


Your profile

To be successful in this position, you should bring the following to the table:


Passion for working with relational databases and experience in modeling data structures and designing ETL processes.
Ability to accompany and further develop development processes.
Solution-oriented handling of complex issues and independent driving force in the development of reporting tools.
Experience in working with customers and sound consulting skills.
Familiarity with ITIL processes and ensuring operations.


This position doesn't suit you?

The job advertisement doesn't match what you want? We are looking for IT consultants with a wide range of specializations. We would be happy to find out what we can do for you in an initial phone call. As we only place IT experts, we are constantly receiving new vacancies in this area. Perhaps we have something with other clients that better suits your plans and wishes.

This is very important to our client


As an owner-managed company, our client can concentrate fully on the needs of its customers and employees.
Mutual appreciation and support, customer orientation and a down-to-earth attitude are among the core values and should also be your top priority.
Openness, friendliness and patience should be among your basic characteristics. You enjoy dealing and working with a wide variety of people - whether internally in a team or externally with customers.
At the same time, you will be given plenty of scope to contribute your expertise to the development of innovative solutions for customers.
Our client is proud of the fact that new team members often find their professional home in the company and stay on board for a long time.


What our client offers


Your onboarding is coordinated and supported by a dedicated team.
As part of your 40-hour week, you can look forward to flexible working hours that you can adapt to your individual rhythm of life.
It is possible to work remotely. However, you are of course also welcome in the office at the nearest location
You can choose from a wide range of work equipment such as notebooks and smartphones.
You can choose between a company car or a generous mobility allowance.
Well-equipped flex offices are available to consultants at each location.
Thanks to a wide range of training courses, most of which are held internally, you will always be up to date.
Two additional certifications per year
The values of respect, helpfulness and down-to-earthness, as well as flat hierarchies and the consistently appreciative atmosphere, make it easy for you to feel at home.
The owner-managed company is growing sustainably and sensibly, not only securing existing jobs, but also continuously creating new ones - like this one.


This is how it continues


Please apply directly online by clicking on the Apply for this job now button.
If you have any questions, please use the contact details of the contact person.
We will then arrange a telephone appointment for a short interview.
If you are interested, we will then introduce you to our client and guide you through the entire application process.


Would you like to switch? That's between us!

If you are in an employment relationship that has not been terminated, we will of course ensure that your application is treated with the utmost confidentiality.


We will only contact your current or former employer with your consent.
Telephone interviews and job interviews also after hours.


# Does that sound good? Then apply now. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Data & Reporting Analyst (m/w/d) - Business Analysis, Datenbankentwicklung/BI, Ingenieur
Description:
Für unser hoch motiviertes Team im Bereich des CTO suchen wir für unseren Standort in Berlin, Bonn, Dresden oder Essen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt Deinen klugen Kopf. Deine Aufgaben Du verantwortest die Aufbereitung und Erstellung von Reports (in Power BI o.ä.) und Kennzahlen für den CTO und das Produktmanagement Dabei betreust Du die Abstimmung fachlicher und technischer Werkzeug Schnittstellen (Operations und Finanzen) Zusätzlich gehört die Zusammenfassung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quelldateien sowie die Extraktion von Daten aus ERP und CRM Systemen zu Deinen Kernaufgaben Dein Profil Du verfügst über ein Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik, mindestens im Bachelor oder über eine vergleichbare Ausbildung Berufserfahrung im Umfeld des Produktmanagements ist für diese Position gewünscht Du besitzt tiefere Kenntnisse in Excel und Power BI, SQL, DAX, Power Query sowie SAP Du hast zudem ein solides Verständnis im Bereich SW-Engineering Du präsentierst Dich durch sicheres Auftreten und gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten Eine sorgfältige Arbeitsweise sowie eine hohe Affinität für Struktur und Ordnung zeichnen Dich aus Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift runden Dein Profil ab Unser Angebot Wir bieten spannende Herausforderungen in einem eingespielten Team mit vielseitigen und abwechslungsreichen Aufgaben und Themengebieten. Du kannst bei uns interessante Aufgaben im Bereich der IT-Sicherheit wahrnehmen und zur eigenen Expertise machen. Dich erwarten eine attraktive, leistungsorientierte Vergütung sowie ansprechende Konditionen und Sicherheiten eines erfolgreichen Unternehmens. Deine Fortbildung liegt uns am Herzen. Wir unterstützen Dich bei der Auswahl geeigneter Weiterbildungsmaßnahmen, um Dein Wissen auszubauen und Know-How einzubringen. Die moderne Arbeitswelt spielt bei uns eine große Rolle - wir bieten Vertrauensarbeitszeit, verschiedene Mobile-Office-Modelle, Shared-Desk und Zweier-Büros – lass uns drüber reden, welche Arbeitsform am besten zu Dir passt! Arbeiten im EU-Ausland? Kein Problem - du kannst bis zu 20 Tage remote innerhalb der EU arbeiten. Dein Kontakt zu uns secunet Security Networks AG Frau Nicole Schulz Kurfürstenstraße 58 45138 Essen Telefon: +49 201 5454-0 Wenn Du gern an der Spitze der technologischen Entwicklung arbeiten möchtest, in einem Klima, das von Vertrauen und Fairness geprägt ist, sollten wir uns kennen lernen. Wir freuen uns auf Deine vollständige Bewerbung, in der Du bitte Deine Kündigungsfrist, Deine Gehaltsvorstellung sowie die Kennziffer 2966/F angibst.

Title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir sind ein globales und schnell wachsendes Specialty Pharmaunternehmen mit einem außergewöhnlichen, nachhaltigen Geschäftsmodell. Unsere Mission: DIE Plattform für etablierte und vertraute Markenprodukte diverser Therapiegebiete und Indikationen zu sein und deren Verfügbarkeit in höchster Qualität als wichtiger Partner der innovationsgetriebenen Pharmaindustrie für den Weltmarkt zu sichern!

Wir haben ein gemeinsames Ziel: Die Gesundheit und das Leben der Menschen zu verbessern. Deshalb denken wir nicht in Kategorien mit schnellen Effekten, sondern wollen mit unserem Tun und Handeln mehr bewirken – langfristig und verlässlich.

All das geht nur mit Menschen, die ihren Beruf nicht einfach nur ausüben, sondern selbst etwas erreichen wollen. Wir sind dabei so erfolgreich, weil wir unsere Kolleginnen und Kollegen entwickeln und fördern und ihnen die Freiräume und Flexibilität gewähren, die sie für ihre tägliche Arbeit benötigen. Wenn Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsgeschichte sein wollen, freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!

Ihre Aufgaben


Sie unterstützen unsere Fachbereiche bei der Auswertung und der Interpretation von Daten
Sie erstellen aussagekräftige Power BI Reports, um komplexe Daten verständlicher und präsentierbar zu machen
Sie unterstützen bei der Konzeption und Weiterentwicklung unsere Daten Plattform auf Basis von Microsoft Fabric
Sie sind Ansprechpartner:in rund um analytische Fragestellungen für unsere Fachbereiche
Sie arbeiten eng mit unseren externen Dienstleistern zusammen und übernehmen Steuerungsaufgaben


Ihr Profil


Sie haben einen Hochschulabschluss in Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik oder Betriebswirtschaft oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Sie haben bereits 3-5 Jahre Erfahrung im BI Umfeld und in der Nutzung von Power BI
Sie bringen fundierte Kenntnisse im Bereich multidimensionaler und tabular Datenmodellen auf Basis des Star Schema Konzeptes mit
Sie sind versiert im Umgang mit SQL und DAX
Erfahrung in der Administration / Management des Power BI Service runden Ihr Profil ab
Sie kommunizieren sicher in der deutschen und englischen Sprache


Unser Angebot


Agilität sowie deutliches und kontinuierliches Unternehmenswachstum
Direkte und offene Unternehmenskultur
Interne und externe Fortbildungen
Firmenevents
Mehr Flexibilität: Ortsunabhängige Arbeitsmodelle mit definierten Präsenztagen möglich


Bitte nutzen Sie für Ihre Bewerbung ausschließlich die "Jetzt bewerben!" Funktion.
Show more

  • Interne und externe Fortbildungen
  • Firmenevents
  • Mehr Flexibilität: Ortsunabhängige Arbeitsmodelle mit definierten Präsenztagen möglich

Bitte nutzen Sie für Ihre Bewerbung ausschließlich die "Jetzt bewerben!" Funktion.

Title: Junior BI Analyst - Startup (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir sind ein dynamisches Beratungsteam, das es sich zum Ziel gemacht hat, schlanke, digitale und nachhaltige Finanz- und Admin-Lösungen für Startups zu entwickeln und umzusetzen. Wir verstehen uns als externes Finance Office und bilden dabei das gesamte Finance-Themenspektrum, von Buchhaltung bis BI-Reporting ab.

Aufgaben


Du unterstützt das Team rund um das Thema Business Intelligence & Data Analytics
Du entwickelst eigenständig Reporting Dashboards und Kennzahlen in Power BI
Du begleitest du die Analyse, Aufnahme und Dokumentation von Planungs- und Reportingprozessen in vielfältigen Unternehmensfunktionen (z.B. Finanzen, Controlling).
Du wirst aktiv in unsere Kundenprojekte eingebunden und übernimmst vielfältige Aufgaben


Qualifikation


Du hast Betriebswirtschaft, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder etwas vergleichbares, idealerweise mit einer Spezialisierung auf Finanzen studiert (der Abschluss ist nicht erforderlich)
Du verfügst über erste Berufserfahrungen im Bereich Business Intelligence und hast bereits erste Erfahrungen mit Power BI oder anderen BI Lösungen gemacht
Du kannst analytisch denken, hast eine Affinität zu Zahlen und eine Hands-on Mentalität
Du interessierst dich für neue Geschäftsmodelle und den Aufbau von finanziellen Grundstrukturen und -prozessen (Financial Planning)
Du kannst selbstständig arbeiten und hast keine Angst davor, die Initiative zu ergreifen
Du besitzt verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse (C2) und idealerweise gute Englischkenntnisse (C1)
Du bist motiviert, diszipliniert und lösungsorientiert


Benefits


Eine steile Lernkurve durch die direkte Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Gründern
Wir sind ein kleines agiles Team, das Wert auf Austausch, Offenheit und das Einbringen von Ideen setzt
Einblick in eine Vielfalt von Unternehmen und Geschäftsmodellen durch die verschiedenen Kundenprojekte
Einen modern ausgestatteter Arbeitsplatz mitten in Kreuzberg umgeben von Startups und einem kulinarischen Hotspot
Die Möglichkeit flexibel in Office und Home-Office zu arbeiten
Eine freundliche, interessante und kooperative Arbeitsatmosphäre
Regelmäßige Teamevents und regelmäßige Feedback Gespräche
Show more
