Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (M/W/D)
Description:
Company Description

You'll be joining one of the world’s largest privately owned real estate tech companies and a subsidiary of Axel Springer. Our mission is to unlock everyone’s perfect place! You'll work across some of Europe’s best known digital real estate brands including: 🇫🇷 Meilleurs Agents, 🇫🇷 Groupe SeLoger, 🇧🇪 Immoweb, 🇩🇪 Immowelt, 🇪🇸 Housell and 🇮🇱 Yad2.

You’re most productive when you have the freedom to work with true flexibility.

That’s what we offer you here at AVIV Group.

What We Do At Business Intelligence

The BI team plays a crucial role in enabling data-driven decision-making across AVIV Group. We specialize in transforming raw data into actionable insights, empowering teams to make informed and strategic decisions.

The primary objective of the BI team is to equip key departments, such as HR, Finance, Management, and Pricing, with data-driven insights that enhance operational efficiency, drive strategic initiatives, and support overall business performance. We achieve this by implementing automated systems for monitoring critical KPIs such as company's core metrics, including objectives and key results (OKRs) and financial performance. In addition to ongoing KPI monitoring, the BI team conducts in-depth analyses, such as evaluating trends in financial performance and pricing strategies. We provide easy-to-access dashboards, along with both ad-hoc and comprehensive analyses, enabling stakeholders to track, assess, and act on key insights to optimise outcomes across the organisation.

Job Description

WE ARE LOOKING FOR AN INDIVIDUAL WHO CAN:


Working closely with many stakeholders such as AVIV executive team, Axel Springer, Finance, B2B Marketing, Commercial and Segment Managers, Go to Market Team understand their needs and provide reporting solutions that fulfil their expectations.
Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance.
Present findings and recommendations to senior management and other stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Assist in the development of business strategies by providing data-driven insights and forecasts.
Lead BI projects, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with business goals.
Taking over ad-hoc analysis, reportings and visualizations for all AVIV brands.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data to inform business stakeholders.
Advise and support the AVIV data engineers team in implementing the business logics in the process of data transformation.
Be the spokesperson for the main internal and external stakeholders.
Promote a datafy culture among the company.


Qualifications

AN INDIVIDUAL WHO HAS:


You have significant experience in the data analytics field
You have an advanced analytical mindset and experience uncovering data insights to form hypothesis, evaluating results and making recommendation
You have proven experience in the project management, being able to prioritize and guide others on data and business objectives
You have analytics skills and have experience on the following aspects:
Business Intelligence: solid professional experience in the field of data analysis, business intelligence, or analytics engineering
Data Warehousing and Data Modeling: skilled in creating and optimizing data models, collaborating seamlessly with data engineers to align with business needs
Relational databases: expertise in working with relational databases (e.g. MS SQL Server)
AWS Athena familiarity: expertise in working with AWS Athena, including the ability to efficiently query large datasets stored in S3 using SQL. Experience with Glue would be highly beneficial
Advanced knowledge of SQL: proficient in utilizing advanced SQL techniques for comprehensive data analysis
Dashboarding (Advanced knowledge of Tableau): skilled in creating interactive and visually appealing dashboards using Tableau for effective data presentation
Python proficiency: an additional advantage is proficiency in Python for data analytics, enhancing the ability to automate processes and perform advanced analyses
You possess a keen attention to detail, ensuring the accuracy and precision of data analysis and reporting
You are solution-oriented and able to take initiative independently
Ability to communicate effectively with international cross functional teams (fluency in English is required, French and German would be beneficial)


Additional Information

NEXT STEPS:

Unlock your perfect job with us today and make an application. The recruitment process includes:


Phone call with recruiter (expectations and circumstances)
Hiring Manager Interview
Case study


BENEFITS:


30 days annual leave
Hybrid or remote working options
Flexible working hours
Company pension scheme
€50 public transport allowance
€100 allowance for glasses
A mix of Health and Wellbeing benefits
Bicycle leasing (Job Rad)
Berlin only - Subsidised canteen
Berlin only - Kindergarten
Charity fundraisers


At AVIV, we are an equal opportunities employer and an organisation where everyone is welcomed to be their authentic selves. We strongly encourage individuals with visible and non visible disabilities, all educational backgrounds, people from minority backgrounds, those from the LGBTQIA+ community and parents and carers to apply. If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, or wish to discuss part time or flexible working requirements, please let us know.In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Our ambition is to be the leading Employer in PropTech across Europe and this is a pivotal time to join us and unlock your perfect job!
Show more

Title: Staff/Principal Data Analyst (d/f/m)
Description:
The Role: How you'll make an impact at Personio

This position can be office-based or hybrid, from one of the following countries: Germany, Spain, Ireland, the Netherlands, or the UK.

Drive Strategic Decisions. Shape Our Future. The Data Department is on a mission to facilitate better decisions within the company. We build core data products and enable internal teams to create and share their own. Join our team and help us build the foundation of data at Personio.

As a Staff/Principal Data Analyst supporting the Finance, Legal, and Strategy (FLS) team at Personio, you play a pivotal role in transforming data into strategic insights, shaping our company’s financial strategy. In this role, you're not just analyzing numbers; you're driving critical business decisions and influencing long-term strategies. Your insights directly impact our financial health and strategic direction, making your contribution vital to our mission of sustainable growth and operational excellence.

Role Responsibilities: What you'll do


Strategic Business Partnership: Act as a primary data strategist for the organization, partnering with top executives. Regularly consult with the CFO and other executives, providing data-driven guidance on major strategic initiatives and long-term planning.
Data Analysis: Analyze and interpret diverse datasets, focusing on financial performance, legal trends, and strategic initiatives to guide FLS in making informed, data-driven decisions.
Dashboard Development: Create and strategize the evolution of real-time, interactive dashboards for stakeholders, ensuring they are user-friendly and aligned with the evolving needs of the business.
Business Reviews and Insight Generation: Oversee the insight generation process for business reviews at a company-wide level, guiding analysts in different departments to highlight crucial insights and trends.
Strategic Planning: Collaborate with leadership and peers in developing business strategies grounded in data insights, aimed at growth, operational optimization, and cost reduction.
Stakeholder Management: Lead multiple projects simultaneously, managing expectations and collaborating with the data team for internal consistency, scalability, and reliability of data practices.
Proactive Team Embedding: Act as a strategic data partner for multiple teams, guiding them in aligning their objectives with data insights. Lead initiatives to use data in solving complex business challenges.


Role Requirements: What you need to succeed


Education & Experience: A quantitative degree (e.g., Applied Math, Econ, Stats, Eng, CS) paired with a minimum of 7 years of data analytics experience, in a SaaS, Subscription, or B2B environment with a focus on Finance, Legal, and Strategy. Experience working with executive-level stakeholders (CFO, CEO, …).
Deep understanding of SaaS-specific financial processes and financial systems like Salesforce, Chargebee, Adaptive.
KPI and Dashboard Expertise: Strong understanding of financial and strategic KPIs and proficient in creating scalable dashboards that effectively translate business requirements into impactful visuals.
Technical Proficiency: Advanced skills in SQL and BI/Visualization tools like Tableau, facilitating data extraction, manipulation, and presentation.
Statistical Knowledge: Master the use of cutting-edge statistical methods and tools, providing strategic guidance and recommendations based on sophisticated data analysis.
Analytical Mindset: Intellectual curiosity to delve deep into data, identifying underlying trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Communication Skills: Ability to articulate complex data observations in simple terms, ensuring clarity and understanding among stakeholders. Master the art of storytelling with data, driving organizational change and strategy through powerful presentations and reports.
Entrepreneurial Approach: A proactive problem-solver, focused on generating impactful results and identifying opportunities for improvement through data-driven insights.


Why Personio

Personio is an equal opportunities employer, committed to building an integrative culture where everyone feels welcomed and supported. We embrace uniqueness and understand that our diverse, values-driven culture makes us stronger. We are proud to have an inclusive workplace environment that will foster your development no matter your gender, civil status, family status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, education level, or race.

Benefits

Aside from our people, culture, and mission, check out some of the other benefits that make Personio a great place to work:


Receive a competitive reward package – reevaluated each year – that includes salary, benefits, and pre-IPO equity
Enjoy 28 days of paid vacation, plus an additional day after 2 and 4 years (because we love what we do, but we also love vacation!)
Make an impact on the environment and society with 2 (fully paid) Impact Days – one for an individual project of your choice and one for a company-wide initiative
Receive generous family leave, child support, mental health support, and sabbatical opportunities with PersonioCares
Find your best way to work with our office-led, remote-friendly PersonioFlex! Most teams offer a roughly 50% remote, 50% in-office working framework
Invest in your development with an annual personal development budget to use on professional memberships, external certifications, conferences, and more
Connect with your fellow Personios at regular company and team events like All Company Culture Week and local year-end celebrations
Engage in a high-impact working environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes


About Us

Bring your best. Make your mark. We’re using technology to revolutionize the way HR operates so that we can transform the way millions of people experience work every day. We move fast, challenge the status quo, and support our people as they shape their careers.

With over 10,000 customers and a team of 2,000 in eight offices around the world, now is the perfect time to join! We believe in hiring driven people who want to make an impact. So bring your best, and let’s build the future of HR technology together.

Discover our Personio Principles, that guide our mindset, behaviours, and the ways we work together:

Exceed Customer Expectations: We anticipate, prioritize, and solve for the needs of our customers.

Deliver Exceptional Results: We dream big and move with urgency to make great things happen.

Elevate One Another: We work together as trusted partners to amplify our collective impact.

Care to Challenge: We care personally and challenge directly to unlock our full potential.

Ignite Positive Momentum: We embrace the challenge with a positive mindset and celebrate our wins together.
Show more

Exceed Customer Expectations: We anticipate, prioritize, and solve for the needs of our customers.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
Bonial helps you save time, money and paper!

We are a digital advertising partner for offline businesses - we support retailers in their marketing activities and help them find a new audience. Would you like to join and be a part of digitalisation of retail?

Company Description

Our Head of Data says: “Data is one of the hubs between Online Marketing, Product, IT and Sales here at Bonial.com. New questions are raised every day that cover all facets of business intelligence, such as developing a prediction model for user retention, defining KPIs and events for an A/B test, integrating a new data source in our enterprise data architecture or supporting critical business decisions by translating business problems into quantitative terms.” Our mission is to transform data into knowledge to enable people to make smart decisions. As data team, we want Bonial to be more data-driven. Therefore, our role is to transform the decision-making process from gut-feeling towards a scientific approach.

Job Description

As a data analyst in the Sales Intelligence team, you will join a diverse cast of different, funny people! One of your main roles will be to act as a mediator between our data universe & our stakeholders. Our main mission is to transform existing data into knowledge that can be employed in an operational sense and empower our stakeholders. When it comes to achieving this goal, you are often (not always 😉) free to apply different methodological approaches - from creating highly complex dashboards, to classical in-depth analyses, to automating processes - there are almost no boundaries to your creativity! In short, you will work on end-to-end aspects of data analysis: from gathering, cleaning, and crunching data to creating analysis, visualizing insights, and automating reports. Therefore, it is also important that you are able and willing to freely communicate your ideas, results and work to your peers and stakeholders. All of this is enhanced by your drive to always wanting to learn more, growing personally as well as professionally and a fiery passion for what you do!

Your responsibilities:


Perform deep-dive analysis to support decision-making, such as to give meaning to data, identify opportunities and issues, and present analysis and findings to stakeholders.
Work closely with a variety of different departments on a range of interesting initiatives, but also tracking implementation strategies for new products and data quality in general.
Develop relevant metrics/KPIs and create reports, visualisations, dashboards (using Power BI, Redash, etc) to enable business-critical decision-making process.
Proactively identify opportunities where data can influence our product & marketing strategy
Improve data practices (tools and best practices) in Bonial.



Your profile:


You hold a degree in business, economics, mathematics, statistics or equivalent (technical) field and you have a ‘can-do’ attitude with a passion for analytics and data.
A strong ability to understand and incorporate the big picture into the details of an analysis.
Well structured, analytical thinking and ability to explain and visualize complex analysis in a clear understandable manner to a non-technical audience.
Entrepreneurial mindset, you are keen on making recommendations that will positively impact Bonial, you proactively drive change
At least 3+ years of experience in data
Fluent in SQL
Strong knowledge in a programming language, e.g. Python, R, etc.
Good experience with data visualization tools, e.g. Excel, Power BI, etc.
Having experience with big data tools is a plus.
You can communicate fluently in English. [German and/or French would be a nice bonus].
Last, but not least: motivation and passion for what you do! Openness to learn new things



What we can offer you:

Diversity - proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we aim to enable everyone to show up as their full selves. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and to being a safe space regardless of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender, gender identity or gender expression.

Development - strong support for your professional development with an internal Learning Hub and a feedback culture to help you identify your strengths and opportunities.

Wellbeing - we believe mental health is as important as being fit. That's why we're giving you free access to Nilo, a mental health app. And we can also offer you a corporate pension scheme so you don't have to worry about your retirement.

Sustainability - together with our Green team, we offer you the opportunity to engage in projects that promote sustainability, environmental development and the impact that we make on our planet.

Flexibility - we offer flexible hours, a hybrid setup, and the option of working from abroad 30 days per year. We offer 28 days of holiday, additionally, you get an extra day for each calendar year (up to 30 days) and other occasions (moving, working on a social project, etc).

Modern office - Zen Rooms where employees can pray, relax or simply have some quiet time; fully equipped gym in the office; and a roof terrace for amazing social events.

Free lunch – whenever you’re at the office, we currently offer you different lunch options – and it’s all on us! Hot and cold drinks, fruit, and other snacks at the office are, of course, also free for our employees.

Social Culture which encourages people to start conversations, build relationships and participate together in the community through regular team events.

Visa Sponsorship: We provide visa sponsorship for those of you who are eager to join us from outside of Germany.

If you think you could fit the bill, we'd love to hear from you!

You can check out our Bonial_people Instagram or read more about Bonial culture and tech on Medium.
Show more
HTML:
Bonial helps you save time, money and paper!

We are a digital advertising partner for offline businesses - we support retailers in their marketing activities and help them find a new audience. Would you like to join and be a part of digitalisation of retail?

Company Description

Our Head of Data says: “Data is one of the hubs between Online Marketing, Product, IT and Sales here at Bonial.com. New questions are raised every day that cover all facets of business intelligence, such as developing a prediction model for user retention, defining KPIs and events for an A/B test, integrating a new data source in our enterprise data architecture or supporting critical business decisions by translating business problems into quantitative terms.” Our mission is to transform data into knowledge to enable people to make smart decisions. As data team, we want Bonial to be more data-driven. Therefore, our role is to transform the decision-making process from gut-feeling towards a scientific approach.

Job Description

As a data analyst in the Sales Intelligence team, you will join a diverse cast of different, funny people! One of your main roles will be to act as a mediator between our data universe & our stakeholders. Our main mission is to transform existing data into knowledge that can be employed in an operational sense and empower our stakeholders. When it comes to achieving this goal, you are often (not always 😉) free to apply different methodological approaches - from creating highly complex dashboards, to classical in-depth analyses, to automating processes - there are almost no boundaries to your creativity! In short, you will work on end-to-end aspects of data analysis: from gathering, cleaning, and crunching data to creating analysis, visualizing insights, and automating reports. Therefore, it is also important that you are able and willing to freely communicate your ideas, results and work to your peers and stakeholders. All of this is enhanced by your drive to always wanting to learn more, growing personally as well as professionally and a fiery passion for what you do!

Your responsibilities:

  • Perform deep-dive analysis to support decision-making, such as to give meaning to data, identify opportunities and issues, and present analysis and findings to stakeholders.
  • Work closely with a variety of different departments on a range of interesting initiatives, but also tracking implementation strategies for new products and data quality in general.
  • Develop relevant metrics/KPIs and create reports, visualisations, dashboards (using Power BI, Redash, etc) to enable business-critical decision-making process.
  • Proactively identify opportunities where data can influence our product & marketing strategy
  • Improve data practices (tools and best practices) in Bonial.


Your profile:

  • You hold a degree in business, economics, mathematics, statistics or equivalent (technical) field and you have a ‘can-do’ attitude with a passion for analytics and data.
  • A strong ability to understand and incorporate the big picture into the details of an analysis.
  • Well structured, analytical thinking and ability to explain and visualize complex analysis in a clear understandable manner to a non-technical audience.
  • Entrepreneurial mindset, you are keen on making recommendations that will positively impact Bonial, you proactively drive change
  • At least 3+ years of experience in data
  • Fluent in SQL
  • Strong knowledge in a programming language, e.g. Python, R, etc.
  • Good experience with data visualization tools, e.g. Excel, Power BI, etc.
  • Having experience with big data tools is a plus.
  • You can communicate fluently in English. [German and/or French would be a nice bonus].
  • Last, but not least: motivation and passion for what you do! Openness to learn new things


What we can offer you:

Diversity - proud to be an equal opportunity workplace where we aim to enable everyone to show up as their full selves. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and to being a safe space regardless of race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender, gender identity or gender expression.

Development - strong support for your professional development with an internal Learning Hub and a feedback culture to help you identify your strengths and opportunities.

Wellbeing - we believe mental health is as important as being fit. That's why we're giving you free access to Nilo, a mental health app. And we can also offer you a corporate pension scheme so you don't have to worry about your retirement.

Sustainability - together with our Green team, we offer you the opportunity to engage in projects that promote sustainability, environmental development and the impact that we make on our planet.

Flexibility - we offer flexible hours, a hybrid setup, and the option of working from abroad 30 days per year. We offer 28 days of holiday, additionally, you get an extra day for each calendar year (up to 30 days) and other occasions (moving, working on a social project, etc).

Modern office - Zen Rooms where employees can pray, relax or simply have some quiet time; fully equipped gym in the office; and a roof terrace for amazing social events.

Free lunch – whenever you’re at the office, we currently offer you different lunch options – and it’s all on us! Hot and cold drinks, fruit, and other snacks at the office are, of course, also free for our employees.

Social Culture which encourages people to start conversations, build relationships and participate together in the community through regular team events.

Visa Sponsorship: We provide visa sponsorship for those of you who are eager to join us from outside of Germany.

If you think you could fit the bill, we'd love to hear from you!

You can check out our Bonial_people Instagram or read more about Bonial culture and tech on Medium.

Title: Data Analyst-Engineer
Description:
Title : DATA Analytics Engineer (m/w/d) Salary : €65.000 - €80,000 per annum Sector : IT, Technology, Consulting Stellenbeschreibung: Data Analytics Engineer (m/w/d) Über die Position: Wir suchen erfahrene Data Analytics Engineers mit mindestens 4 Jahren Berufserfahrung im Bereich mathematisch-statistischer Datenanalyse und Datenarchitekturen. Du wirst eigenverantwortlich in einem innovativen, agilen Team arbeiten, das sich auf moderne Technologien und die Transformation bestehender Datenprozesse fokussiert. Deine Aufgaben: Du arbeitest remote in einem dynamischen Daten-Team, das sich auf die Analyse und Transformation komplexer Datenstrukturen konzentriert. Du entwickelst Lösungen mit Schwerpunkt auf Azure Synapse , SQL (MySQL, MS SQL), DAC-Paketen und API-Implementierungen (REST, GraphQL). Deine Hauptaufgabe liegt in der Arbeit am Anti Corruption Layer , der als Datendrehscheibe zwischen Altsystemen und neuen Cloud-basierten Services fungiert. Du erkennst verborgene Muster in den Geschäftsdaten und entwickelst prädiktive Modelle zur Unterstützung datenbasierter Entscheidungen. Du unterstützt die nachhaltige Überführung von Softwaresystemen in einen neuen .NET (C#)-Techstack . Zudem erstellst du Tests und Dokumentationen für die entwickelten Funktionalitäten (z.B. arc42). Tech-Stack: Azure Synapse SQL (MySQL, MS SQL) DAC-Pakete API-Implementierungen (REST, GraphQL) .NET (C#) Dein Profil: Du bringst mindestens 3-4 Jahre Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit Microsoft-Technologien und datengetriebenen Projekten mit. Fundierte Kenntnisse in modernen Tools und Technologien. Erfahrung in der Implementierung und Optimierung von Datenprozessen in Projekten oder Inhouse-Umgebungen. Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse (mind. C1-Niveau). Must-Haves: Tiefgehende Erfahrung mit Azure und Microsoft-Technologien . Eigenständiges Arbeiten und die Fähigkeit, technische Chancen und Risiken zu erkennen und zu kommunizieren. Interesse und Fähigkeit, neue Technologien und Konzepte in die tägliche Arbeit einzubringen. No-Go’s: Fehlende Erfahrung mit Azure oder Microsoft -Technologien.

Title: Game Data Analyst (World of Warships)
Description:
Job Overview

Wargaming is looking for a Game Data Analyst to work on World of Warships , World of Warships: Legends and World of Warships: Blitz in our brand to strengthen the World of Warships product analytics team.

You will be a part of the team working on analyzing, visualizing, monitoring and managing data of three World of Warships Franchise games. We cover all kinds of products' needs ranging from in-game battle analysis to game economy and financial monitoring. We work extensively with game production team for both providing sufficient data for informed decisions and to enhance data processes within the development.

Reports to

Our future colleague will report to BI Team Lead

What will you do?


Work closely with internal customers and stakeholders to elicit business requirements and transform them into valuable BI reports / research reports for senior management and product teams all over the globe;
Identify the key needs and point of growth of the development team and identify which data and how can enhance the decision-making process;
Define the format and to provide the decision support outputs (dashboards, ad hoc reports);
Determine key measurement metrics for new functionality and define tracking strategy;
Consult users and lead cross-functional teams to address business issues, if necessary;
Directly produce datasets and reports for analysis using various system reporting tools, if necessary.


What are we looking for?


3+ year experience on similar position;
Experience in game development (2+ years) and understanding of game production processes and needs;
Advanced knowledge of SQL at the level of complex queries;
Data visualization skills, proficiency with BI instruments (we use Tableau);
Good mathematical knowledge and knowledge of statistics;
Knowledge of Python popular libraries for data processing and analysis;
Experienced in working with DWH, overall understanding of DWH design and operations;
Written and spoken English (B2 and higher).


What additional skills will help you stand out?


Experience in Wargaming games
Understanding of multiplatform game analysis basics (PC, mobile, console).


Work mode

Hybrid (2-3 days of work from the office)

Benefits

Benefits and perks are tailored to the local market and culture. Our benefits in Belgrade include:


Additional Vacation days on top of the statutory minimum dependent on years of service with Wargaming Group
Up to 8 "Trust days" per calendar year that require no medical certificate
Career development and education opportunities within the company
English clubs and platform for learning languages
Premium Private Health Care
Mental well-being program (iFeel)
Commuting allowance
Gym trainings / Wellness program
Personal Gaming Account
Coffee, fruits, and snacks in the office
Company events
Seniority Awards
Referral program - you can recommend the best talents to the Company and receive a reward


Please submit your CV in English to ensure smooth processing and review.

About Wargaming

Wargaming is an award-winning online game developer and publisher headquartered in Nicosia, Cyprus. Operating since 1998, Wargaming has become one of the leaders in the gaming industry with 15 offices worldwide, including studios in Chicago, Prague, Shanghai, Tokyo, and Vilnius. Our diverse and multicultural team works together to deliver a top-class experience to millions of players who enjoy Wargaming's titles across all major gaming platforms. Our flagship products include free-to-play hits World of Tanks, World of Warships and World of Tanks Blitz.

Please see Wargaming Candidate Privacy Policy for details on how Wargaming uses your personal data.

Title: Data Analyst Insurance (m/w/d)
Description:
Werde Teil des Verivox Teams!

Du fühlst Dich in der Welt der Daten zuhause und möchtest die Zukunft unserer Versicherungssparte aktiv mitgestalten? Dann bist Du bei uns genau richtig:

Für unseren Standort in Leipzig, Heidelberg, Berlin oder München suchen wir dich mit mehrtägiger Mobile Office Option pro Woche in Vollzeit (40 h) zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt als Data Analyst Insurance (m/w/d)

Deine Mission


Du wendest deine gesammelten Erfahrungen im Bereich Mathematik/Statistik und Informatik in Kombination an
Mit explorativer Datenanalyse und Machine Learning Modellen beantwortest du Fragen der Stakeholder
Durch Analysen, Deepdives und in Reporten findest du Probleme, die den Weg zu neuen und wertvollen Lösungen ebenen können


Das bringst du mit


Du hast ein abgeschlossenes naturwissenschaftliches Studium, idealerweise mit Schwerpunkt Mathematik/Statistik und Informatik
Du besitzt mehrjährige Berufserfahrung in einer vergleichbaren Rolle und hast gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie mit relationalen Datenbanken
Du bringst Big-Data- und Machine-Learning-relevante Programmierkenntnisse (Python, Pandas, scipy, poetry, etc.) mit, Erfahrungen im Bereich der Datenvisualisierung sind von Vorteil
Du hast praktische Erfahrungen mit Git
Du verfügst über sehr gute deutsche und englische Sprachkenntnisse


Das bieten wir dir


Rund 500 Mitarbeiter aus über 35 Nationen als kollegiale Gemeinschaft
Offene und diverse Unternehmenskultur mit flachen Hierarchien sowie modernem und wertschätzendem Arbeitsumfeld
Großzügige Mobile Office-Regelungen, die flexibles Arbeiten von zu Hause und aus dem EU-Ausland ermöglichen
Eigener Verantwortungsbereich mit Raum zur Entfaltung eigener Ideen und Konzepte
Unkompliziertes Miteinander: wir duzen uns & bestehen nicht auf Dresscodes
Exklusive Mitarbeitervorteile wie Jobticket, Jobrad, Zuschuss zum Mittagessen über Sodexo und Mitarbeiterrabatte
Betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement, wie betriebliche Altersvorsorge, Urban Sportsclub und Mental Health Days
Zentral gelegene Offices in Heidelberg, Berlin, München und Leipzig mit optimaler Verkehrsanbindung


Abbinder

Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann freuen wir uns, dich kennenzulernen. Überzeuge uns davon, dass du uns nach vorne bringst! Bitte sende deine Bewerbung inklusive Gehaltsvorstellung und Kündigungsfrist bzw. frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermin über den Link "Jetzt Bewerben" oder an jobs[AT]verivox.com .

Verivox ist eines der führenden Online-Vergleichsportale in Deutschland. Seit 1998 machen wir Märkte in den Bereichen Strom & Gas, Mobilfunk & Internet sowie Finanzen & Versicherungen transparent. Aus rund 30.000 Tarifen finden wir das beste Angebot für Verbraucherinnen und Verbraucher und helfen so Haushalten, Zeit und Geld zu sparen. Mehr als 8 Millionen Menschen haben mit unserer Hilfe bereits über 2 Milliarden Euro gespart. Seit 2015 ist Verivox Teil der ProSiebenSat.1-Gruppe.

Unternehmenstext

Informiere dich hier über die ProSiebenSat.1 Group und unser vielseitiges Portfolio.

Du hast eine Behinderung und möchtest dich bewerben? Dann bist du bei uns herzlich willkommen.

Wir wissen, dass wir noch nicht gänzlich barrierefrei sind, aber wir arbeiten daran. Lass uns darüber reden, wie wir diese Barriere gemeinsam abschaffen und wenn nötig eine individuelle Lösung finden können.

Ausschließlich aus Gründen der besseren Lesbarkeit wird nur die männliche Form verwendet. Selbstverständlich sind immer alle Geschlechter angesprochen.

Das bieten wir dir: Training and Education Subsidized company pension plan Flexible Working Hours No dress code Team Events Open corporate culture Exclusive employee benefits / discounts


Hybrid Work

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Title: Strategic Data Analyst (d/f/m) AdTech Marketing Salesforce
Description:
Benefits:


Opportunity to use top-notch technology within the ad-tech industry.
3 months onboarding program to get to know the other starters and all the departments.
Mentor program to ensure your further development within the company.
International teams with a strong focus on innovation, feedback and fun.
Hybrid workplace policy: Come to the brand new office in the heart of Berlin or work from home.
EU workation program: Join your colleagues to work in one of their coworking venues in Spain or Croatia.
Monthly lunch club and quarterly after work events.
German and English language classes with teachers onsite in Berlin and Spain as well as tandem language learning program.
30 days vacation.
Health insurance package.
Urban Sports Club membership or Lunch vouchers.
BVG transportation ticket.


Responsibilities:


You help the team to understand the connection between their analytics and the business context.
As an expert in data analytics, you challenge existing practices and identify areas for improvement.
You are responsible for monthly and quarterly reporting, supporting sales and other marketing stakeholders for their strategic decisions.
You improve reports and dashboards to track KPIs related to market performance and campaign effectiveness.
You define and extract valuable insights from complex marketing datasets and hold presentations about it.


Your profile:


Minimum of 5 years work experience in data analytics.
Minimum of 2 years of work experience in a role that holds presentations about key findings in data analytics.
Have been involved in strategic decision making.
Experienced with PowerBI, Tableau or similar.
Proficient in Excel.
Experience with extracting data from Salesforce.
Experience with A/B testing, marketing budget optimization, user acquisition, conversion/purchase prediction, recommendation system, marketing mix modelling (MMM), attribution, bidding automation, lift tests, or geo tests.


Please send your CV to Nathalie; if you have any questions feel free to call/Whatsapp/Signal/Telegram/SMS: +4915733914408.

Title: Lead Analytics Analyst (f/m/x) - Data Analyst in AFC M&S Global Platform
Description:
Position Overview

Die Deutsche Bank (DB) kann auf eine sehr erfahrene und engagierte Abteilung für die Bekämpfung von Finanzkriminalität (Anti Financial Crime, AFC) zurückgreifen. Diese spielt eine entscheidende Rolle dabei, der Finanzkriminalität bei Geschäftsaktivitäten und globalen Finanzdienstleistungen der DB vorzubeugen und gleichzeitig die Interessen der Bank und der Gesellschaft zu wahren.

Um Finanzkriminalität wirksam zu bekämpfen und flexibel auf Herausforderungen zu reagieren, hat AFC eine Matrixstruktur, die regionale, geschäftsbereichsbezogene und globale Funktionen vereint. Sie teilt sich in die folgenden Kernbereiche auf: Anti-Money Laundering, Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud, Bribery & Corruption, Investigations & Intelligence, Monitoring & Screening und Risk Assessment. Teil unseres Engagements ist es, eine enge Zusammenarbeit mit allen Geschäftsbereichen und Unterstützungsfunktionen innerhalb unserer Bank zu stärken.

Was AFC für Sie tun wird

AFC hilft der Deutschen Bank, langfristig Vertrauen und Mehrwert für unsere Kunden, Mitarbeiter*innen und die Gesellschaft zu schaffen. Dabei wenden wir die höchsten Verhaltensstandards an, um den Erfolg der DB bei der Bekämpfung der Finanzkriminalität zu gewährleisten. Wir bieten Ihnen herausfordernde Möglichkeiten, zu lernen, einen Beitrag zu leisten und von Ihrer Reise mit uns zu profitieren. Wir fördern eine offene und integrative Teamkultur mit dem Ziel, eine gesunde, engagierte und gut unterstützte vielfältige Belegschaft aufzubauen und zu erhalten, die in der Lage ist, ihr Bestes zu geben.

Teambeschreibung und Rollendetails

Anti-Financial Crime

Das Management von Risiken im Zusammenhang mit Finanzkriminalität und die Implementierung gültiger und wirksamer Kontrollen, Prozesse und Sicherheitsmaßnahmen haben für die Deutsche Bank höchste Priorität. AFC Monitoring & Screening Global Plattform (GP) ist verantwortlich für die Implementierung der strategischen Transaktionsüberwachungsplattform und die Weiterentwicklung der bestehenden Transaktionsüberwachungs- und Namenslisten-Screening-Systeme. Daten sind die Grundlage für umfassende Kontrollen und ein Schlüsselbereich für die Identifizierung von Risiken im Zusammenhang mit Finanzkriminalität.

Ihre Hauptverantwortlichkeiten

Innerhalb von AFCs GP konzentriert sich die „Intelligence Layer“ Funktion auf die Anwendung erweiterter Analyse Funktionen mit Bezug auf die verwendeten Daten. In dieser Funktion analysieren Sie Daten, und entwickeln daraus Erkenntnisse und Empfehlungen. Sie arbeiten eng mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams zusammen, um Geschäftsanforderungen mit analytischem Fachwissen zu unterstützen. Sie arbeiten mit weiteren Analysten, Dateningenieuren und Wissenschaftlern zusammen, um qualitativ hochwertige Ergebnisse durch die Anwendung fortschrittlicher Analysemethoden auf unsere Daten zu ermöglichen.

Für diese Rolle verfügen Sie über fundierte Erfahrungen in den Bereichen:


Analyse und Zusammensetzung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen, um Trends und Muster zu identifizieren
Umsetzung von Geschäftsanforderungen und Risikodefinitionen in anwendbare Analyseaktivitäten und Entwicklung von Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen zur Unterstützung von Anforderungen im Bereich Anti-Financial Crime
Transformation von Daten in verwendbare Formate und standardisierte Protokolle
Fähigkeit, ein ganzheitliches Verständnis der bestehenden Daten und Datenquellen der Bank aufzubauen
Entwicklung von Modellen und Datenvisualisierung
der Zusammenarbeit mit Architekten, Infrastrukturexperten und Dateningenieuren in einem internationalen Umfeld für die Datenanalyse



Ihre Kompetenzen und Erfahrungen


Sie verfügen über ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder vergleichbare Qualifikationen und Erfahrungen
Erfahrung mit Datenverarbeitungs- und Integrationspipelines in einem Big Data/ETL-Kontext unter Verwendung von GCP, Hadoop, Apache Spark, Shell-Scripting, Testframeworks oder anderen Komponenten aus dem Ökosystem
Sie haben mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung mit Python, oder ähnlichen Programmiersprachen mit Fokus auf Big Data und ein fundiertes Verständnis für Data Analytics und statistische Methoden
Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Finanzkriminalität und Banken mit deren Transaktionsprozessen
Sie sind ein Teamplayer und verfügen über eine hohe persönliche Integrität mit sehr guten Englischkenntnissen in Wort und Schrift, Deutsch wünschenswert



Die Stelle wird in Voll- und in Teilzeit angeboten

Was wir Ihnen bieten:

Wir bieten eine breite Palette von Leistungen, die all Ihre beruflichen und persönlichen Bedürfnisse abdecken.


Emotional ausgeglichen Eine positive Haltung hilft uns, die Herausforderungen des Alltags zu meistern – beruflich wie privat. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Beratung in schwierigen Lebenssituationen und Angeboten zur Förderung mentaler Gesundheit.
Körperlich fit Mit Angeboten zur Aufrechterhaltung Ihrer persönlichen Gesundheit und einem förderlichen beruflichen Umfeld hilft Ihnen die Bank, körperlich fit zu bleiben. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie umfangreichen Check-up Untersuchungen, Impfangeboten und Beratung zur gesunden Lebensführung.
Sozial vernetzt Der Austausch mit anderen eröffnet uns neue Perspektiven, bringt uns beruflich wie persönlich voran und stärkt unser Selbstvertrauen und Wohlbefinden. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Unterstützung durch den pme Familienservice, das FitnessCenter Job, flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle (bspw. Teilzeit, Jobtandem, hybrides Arbeiten) sowie einer umfangreichen Kultur der Vielfalt, Chancengleichheit und Teilhabe.
Finanziell abgesichert Die Bank sichert Sie nicht nur während Ihrer aktiven Karriere, sondern auch für die Zukunft finanziell ab und unterstützt Ihre Flexibilität sowie Mobilität – egal ob privat oder beruflich. Profitieren Sie von Angeboten wie Beitragsplänen für Altersvorsorge, Bankdienstleistungen für Mitarbeiter*innen, Firmenfahrrad oder dem Deutschlandticket.



Da die Benefits je nach Standort geringfügig variieren, gehen Sie bitte bei konkreten Fragen auf Ihren Recruiter zu.

Die Stelle wird in Voll- und in Teilzeit angeboten.

Bei Fragen zum Rekrutierungsprozess steht Nana Darko gerne zur Verfügung.

Kontakt: Nana Darko (+49(0)175- 6705312 )

Deutsche Bank (DB) benefits from having a highly experienced and dedicated Anti Financial Crime (AFC) function, which performs a crucial role in keeping DBs business operations and global financial services clean from financial crime while serving the interests of the bank and society.

In order to combat financial crime effectively and respond to challenges in a flexible manner, AFC has a matrix structure combining regional, business line and global functional coverage in our core areas of Anti-Money Laundering, Sanctions & Embargoes, Anti-Fraud, Bribery & Corruption, Investigations & Intelligence, Monitoring & Screening, and Risk Assessment. Part of our commitment is to strengthen a strong collaboration with all business lines and support functions within our bank.

What AFC Will Do For You

AFC helps Deutsche Bank generate long-term trust and add value for our clients, staff and society and provide challenging opportunities for you to learn, contribute and benefit from your journey with us. We foster an open and inclusive team culture with the aim to build and maintain a healthy, engaged and well-supported diverse workforce that is equipped to do their best and enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace, whilst applying the highest standards of conduct to guarantee DB´s success in fighting financial crime.

Team- And Role Description

Anti-Financial Crime

The management of financial crime related risks and the implementation of valid and effective controls, processes and security measures has highest priority for Deutsche Bank. AFC Monitoring & Screening Global Platform (GP) is responsible for the implementation of the strategic Transaction Monitoring platform and the further development of the existing Transaction Monitoring and Name List Screening systems. Data is the basis for comprehensive controls and a key area for the identification of financial crime related risk.

Your Main Responsibilities

Within AFCs GP the “Intelligence Layer” has a focus on the application of advanced analytics to the consumed data. As Data Analyst you will be analyzing data and developing insights and recommendations. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to support business requirements with analytical expertise. Collaboration with analysts, data engineers and scientists to enable quality results from the application of advanced analytics methods to our data.

For this role you should have profound experience in the areas of:


collection and analysis of data from various sources to identify trends and patterns
translation of business requirements and risk definitions into actionable analytics activities and developing insights and recommendations to drive business requirements
organizing data into usable formats and standardized protocols
ability to build a broad understanding of the bank's existing data, and data sources
development of models and data visualization
cooperation with architects, infrastructure experts and data engineers on an international framework for data analysis and enrichment



Your Competencies And Experience


You have a degree in computer science, mathematics, physics or comparable qualifications and experience
Experience with data processing and integration pipelines in a big data/ETL context, using Hadoop, Apache Spark, GCP, shell scripting, test frameworks, or other components from the ecosystem
You have at least 3 years of working experience in Python, or similar programming languages with a focus on big data and a sound understanding for data analytics and statistical methods
Experience in the areas of financial crime and banking with their transaction processes
You are a team player and have as well a high level of personal integrity with excellent oral and written English skills, German desirable



This job is available in full and parttime.

What we offer:

We provide you with a comprehensive portfolio of benefits and offerings to support both, your private and professional needs.


Emotionally and mentally balanced A positive mind helps us master the challenges of everyday life – both professionally and privately. We offer consultation in difficult life situations as well as mental health awareness trainings.
Physically thriving We support you in staying physically fit through an offering to maintain personal health and a professional environment. You can benefit from health check-ups; vaccination drives as well as advice on healthy living and nutrition.
Socially connected Networking opens up new perspectives, helps us thrive professionally and personally as well as strengthens our self-confidence and well-being. You can benefit from PME family service, FitnessCenter Job, flexible working (e.g parttime, hybrid working, job tandem) as well as an extensive culture of diversity, equity and inclusion.
Financially secure We provide you with financial security not only during your active career but also for the future. You can benefit from offerings such as pension plans, banking services, company bicycle or “Deutschlandticket”.



Since our offerings slightly vary across locations, please contact your recruiter with specific questions.

In case of any recruitment related questions, please get in touch with Nana Darko.

Contact: Nana Darko (+49(0)175- 6705312 )

Gemeinsam teilen und feiern wir die Erfolge unserer Mitarbeiter*innen. Gemeinsam sind wir die Deutsche Bank Gruppe.

Title: Data / BI Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Ortsunabhängiges Arbeiten & flexible Zeiteinteilung|38,5 h/Woche & 33 Urlaubstage


About Our Client

Für meinen Kunden, einem Beratungsunternehmen in der Gesundheitsbranche, suche ich einen Data/BI-Analysten (m/w/d) mit tiefergehenden Kenntnissen im Bereich SQL. In dieser Position übernimmst du Datenanalysen, erstellst Berichte mit modernen Tools wie Power BI, optimierst die Datenstruktur und -qualität und arbeitest an Projekten zur Anbindung und Anpassung von Datenquellen.

Job Description


Durchführung von Datenauswertungen und Erstellung von Berichten mit Power BI
Ermittlung und Bereitstellung strategischer und operativer Kennzahlen
Beratung der Mitarbeitenden zu Qualitätsprüfungen und Kennzahlen
Analyse und Optimierung der Datenstruktur und -qualität
Sicherstellung reibungsloser Datenverarbeitung und eigenständige Qualitätsprüfungen


The Successful Applicant


Abgeschlossenes Studium mit quantitativen Inhalten (Informatik, Ingenieurs-, Sozial- oder Wirtschaftswissenschaften bevorzugt)
Teamorientierte Person mit starkem IT-Interesse
Erfahrung in Datenbanksystemen (z.B. SQL) und Abfragetechniken
Kenntnisse im BI-Bereich, idealerweise mit Reporting-Tools (z.B. Power BI, Tableau)
Analytisches Denkvermögen, Begeisterung für Datenanalysen und ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten


What's On Offer


Anspruchsvolle Tätigkeit in einer zukunftsorientierten Branche mit unbefristetem Vertrag
Arbeit in einem kreativen, dienstleistungsorientierten Team mit offener Kommunikation
Hoher Gestaltungsfreiraum und Eigenverantwortung im Arbeitsalltag
Individuelle Einarbeitung durch erfahrene Mentoren und moderne Technologien
Familienfreundliche Arbeitsbedingungen mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, 33 Urlaubstagen und attraktiven Zusatzleistungen (TV MD, Weihnachtsgeld, betriebliche Altersvorsorge)


Contact: Emily Sorokin

  • Beratung der Mitarbeitenden zu Qualitätsprüfungen und Kennzahlen
  • Analyse und Optimierung der Datenstruktur und -qualität
  • Sicherstellung reibungsloser Datenverarbeitung und eigenständige Qualitätsprüfungen

The Successful Applicant

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium mit quantitativen Inhalten (Informatik, Ingenieurs-, Sozial- oder Wirtschaftswissenschaften bevorzugt)
  • Teamorientierte Person mit starkem IT-Interesse
  • Erfahrung in Datenbanksystemen (z.B. SQL) und Abfragetechniken
  • Kenntnisse im BI-Bereich, idealerweise mit Reporting-Tools (z.B. Power BI, Tableau)
  • Analytisches Denkvermögen, Begeisterung für Datenanalysen und ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeiten

What's On Offer

  • Anspruchsvolle Tätigkeit in einer zukunftsorientierten Branche mit unbefristetem Vertrag
  • Arbeit in einem kreativen, dienstleistungsorientierten Team mit offener Kommunikation
  • Hoher Gestaltungsfreiraum und Eigenverantwortung im Arbeitsalltag
  • Individuelle Einarbeitung durch erfahrene Mentoren und moderne Technologien
  • Familienfreundliche Arbeitsbedingungen mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, 33 Urlaubstagen und attraktiven Zusatzleistungen (TV MD, Weihnachtsgeld, betriebliche Altersvorsorge)

Contact: Emily Sorokin

Quote job ref: JN-102024-6559845

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Jobbeschreibung

Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d)

ÜBER UNS

Bei Oetker Digital begleiten wir Unternehmen der Oetker-Gruppe auf ihrem Weg in die digitale Zukunft. In enger Zusammenarbeit definieren wir, was digitale Unternehmenstransformation für jedes einzelne Unternehmen bedeutet. Unser Ziel ist es, mithilfe von Daten, Technologie und Talenten messbaren Geschäftswert und Wirkung zu schaffen und so den Weg in eine digitale Zukunft zu ebnen. Wir unterstützen viele beliebte Marken wie Dr. Oetker, Radeberger und Coppenrath & Wiese.

Mit unserem Team von rund 100 talentierten Mitarbeiter:innen und diversen Teams in unserem Berliner Hauptquartier pflegen wir eine offene und positive Lernkultur.

DIE ROLLE

Als Senior Data Analyst bei Oetker Digital übernimmst du eine zentrale Rolle bei datenbasierten Entscheidungen und der Strategieentwicklung. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit Teams und Geschäftspartnern unserer Gruppenunternehmen tauchst du tief in die Geschäftsbereiche und -prozesse ein. Mit deinem Know-how stellst du dabei die richtigen Fragen, analysierst Datensätze, gewinnst wertvolle Erkenntnisse und erstellst auf der Basis unserer Daten Modelle. So unterstützt du unsere Marken maßgeblich bei ihrem Wachstum und Erfolg im digitalen Zeitalter.

DEINE AUFGABEN


Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Business Stakeholder der Oetker Gruppe, um deren Strategien, Bedürfnisse und Ziele zu verstehen
Aufbau und Pflege enger Beziehungen zu wichtigen Geschäftspartnern, um sicherzustellen, dass die Datenlösungen mit den Geschäftszielen übereinstimmen
Als Berater fungieren und durch gezielte Fragen tiefe Einblicke in die Geschäftsbereiche und -prozesse gewinnen
Analysieren von Datensätzen, um verwertbare Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen und datenbasierte Entscheidungsfindung zu unterstützen
Entwicklung und Implementierung statistischer Modelle zur Lösung komplexer Geschäftsprobleme
Kommunikation von Erkenntnissen in überzeugender und verständlicher Form zur Unterstützung datenbasierter Entscheidungsfindung
Übersetzen komplexer Daten in klare, umsetzbare Erkenntnisse z.B. durch Data Storytelling


Stellenanforderungen

WAS DU MITBRINGST


Mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse oder Beratung, vorzugsweise in einem geschäftlichen Kontext, vorzugsweise im Consulting
Bachelor- oder Master-Abschluss in einem verwandten Fachgebiet (z. B. Wirtschaft, Statistik, Mathematik, Informatik)
Kenntnisse in SQL und/oder Python zur Datenanalyse und -modellierung
Erfahrungen mit Cloud-Plattformen zur Datenspeicherung und -verarbeitung, Erfahrungen mit BigQuery sind von Vorteil
Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierung und Software wie Power BI oder Tableau
Eine proaktive und kollaborative Denkweise zusammen mit der Fähigkeit, effektiv in funktionsübergreifenden Teams zu arbeiten
Ausgezeichnete analytische Fähigkeiten und Problemlösungskompetenz verbunden mit Erfahrungen, komplexe Ideen klar zu kommunizieren
Du lernst gerne, arbeitest praxisorientiert, übernimmst Verantwortung und willst etwas verändern
Fließende Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und Englisch


WAS** **WIR BIETEN


Modernes und hundefreundliches Büro im Herzen Berlins
Hybrides Arbeitsmodell mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten für eine gesunde Work-Life-Balance
Wir arbeiten in funktionsübergreifenden und internationalen Teams und veranstalten regelmäßig Firmen- und Teamevents
28 Tage bezahlter Urlaub, plus Weihnachten und Silvester, sowie die Möglichkeit, zusätzlichen unbezahlten Urlaub zu nehmen
10 bezahlte Krankheitstage für Kinder pro Jahr
Jährliches Lern- und Entwicklungsbudget für den Kauf von Bildungsressourcen von bis zu 1.500 €
Ausrüstung nach deiner Wahl: Macbook oder Lenovo, sowie weitere Geräte für die Einrichtung im Home-Office
Bezuschusste Mitgliedschaft im Urban Sports Club oder BVG Deutschland Ticket
Unterstützung beim mentalen Wohlbefinden, einschließlich Einzelsitzungen, durch unseren Partner Likeminded
Betriebliche Altersvorsorge und persönliche Unfallversicherung
Unternehmensrabatte bei einer Vielzahl von externen Partnern
Show more

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (f/m/d) - Finance
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description

What you will do:


Work closely with the VP of FP&A, Head of Finance Transformation and partner closely with Group Accounting and Controlling teams to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Segment Reporting for different business units to provide financial visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Automate the delivery of Monthly Lease data to calculate the asset values under customer lease agreements, ensuring accurate tracking of rent payments, asset lifespan, and customer purchases, for key stakeholders providing an efficient self-service reporting.
Develop deep knowledge of ERP data related to financial transactions and resources, use it to ensure adequate usage & design of ERP in collaboration with the Finance Transformation and the Analytics Engineering Guild teams to contribute to the ERP data modelling for the Finance team.
Closely work with Finance leadership, lead weekly meetings with them, ensure quarterly roadmap planning and drive prioritization.



Qualifications

What you should bring:


5+ years of relevant experience business intelligence, analytics with a strong background in finance or accounting domains.
High proficiency in SQL, ETL processes, and familiarity with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Our tech stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit and Tableau.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines and reporting workflows, especially for monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports.
Strong ability to analyse financial data, identify patterns, and communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring the delivery of clear, understandable financial reports.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments, with a commitment to financial excellence and innovation.



Additional Information

We're offering:


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: there’s plenty of room for your ideas.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.
Show more

Title: Customer Data Analyst (Customer Segmentation) (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando’s Markets organization, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer focussed analytics and segmentations we put our customers at the center of every marketing and retail decision. As a (Senior) Customer Data Analyst in our Customer Segmentation Team you are the closest link to our customer You build a deep understanding of our customer base by developing and analyzing different customer segments based on their purchasing behavior, interests, customer value and onsite activities. You will transform data and segmentations into actionable insights and recommendations that drive strategic decisions and customer retention.

WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



Develop and analyze customer segmentations and audiences, support targeting and steering initiatives to drive customer value and retention. Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to optimize and productionalize your segmentations and audience selections.
Design, conduct and evaluate A/B tests to optimize your segmentations and audiences according to their use case. Recommend testing strategies to optimize targeted campaigns, campaign efficiency and ultimately customer value and retention. Translate complex questions into sound analytical tasks, autonomously planning large scale projects.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify new strategic opportunities and recommend actions supporting the customer strategy. Present your findings and work closely with business stakeholders and product owners to operationalize your recommendations.
Drive data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members in terms of methodology & technology to raise the bar within the department. Collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers and commercial colleagues to untap new sources of data and know-how.
Independently manage analytical projects, identifying efficiency opportunities and supporting decision-making with insights from descriptive and inferential analysis.
Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions, support junior colleagues, and contribute to internal events and the hiring process.



WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



You have 3+ years experience in using customer data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions and/or drive targeting efforts incl. model driven statistical analysis, e.g. Causal Inference. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science.
Advanced skills in data methodologies and technologies (Python and SQL, PySpark). Visualization tools, e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, PowerBI and versioning tools, e.g. Git/GitHub, are considered a plus. Curious about learning new technologies, e.g. Databricks, AWS data lake, Airflow.
Strong communicator to challenge the status-quo, tell data stories, maximize decision impact of your results and liaison with commercial and tech people alike.
Proactive, fast learner, problem solver, teamplayer, comfortable working in English in a fast paced international work environment



INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

Our employee resource groups

https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups

Title: Data analyst (m/f/d) for the development and maintenance of reporting tools in asset management
Description:
Data Analyst (m/f/d) for the development and maintenance of reporting tools in asset management

Fancy exciting data projects? You can have it!

We Are Looking For Immediately

Data Analyst (m/f/d) for the development and maintenance of reporting tools in Asset Management in Munich

We are currently looking for: Data Analyst (m/f/d) for the development and maintenance of reporting tools in Asset Management

Our client is one of Germany's leading IT service providers with over 2,500 employees at more than 26 locations. As an owner-managed and independent system house, the company supplies both private-sector customers from all industries and public-sector clients with high-quality IT solutions. Our client combines high-quality IT products from leading manufacturers with its extensive project expertise, broad range of services and flexibility in order to develop solutions that are optimally tailored to the customer.

Your future area of responsibility

Role

As an independent developer and optimizer of reporting tools, you will play a key role in our company. Your tasks will include:


Development and optimization of reporting tools: You will be responsible for independently developing and continuously improving our reporting tools to deliver a world-class experience to our internal and external customers.
Project responsibility: You take responsibility for work packages and deadlines in projects and help to ensure that our products always meet the future requirements of the financial industry.
Consulting and collaboration: You analyze our customers' requirements and work with them to develop viable solutions. Your in-depth knowledge and solution-oriented approach make you a valued point of contact.
Operations and ITIL processes: You ensure the optimization and safeguarding of operations, successfully implementing ITIL processes such as change, incident and service management. You will also be responsible for creating and updating IT system documentation.


Your profile

To be successful in this position, you should bring the following to the table:


Passion for working with relational databases and experience in modeling data structures and designing ETL processes.
Ability to accompany and further develop development processes.
Solution-oriented handling of complex issues and independent driving force in the development of reporting tools.
Experience in working with customers and sound consulting skills.
Familiarity with ITIL processes and ensuring operations.


This position doesn't suit you?

The job advertisement doesn't match what you want? We are looking for IT consultants with a wide range of specializations. We would be happy to find out what we can do for you in an initial phone call. As we only place IT experts, we are constantly receiving new vacancies in this area. Perhaps we have something with other clients that better suits your plans and wishes.

This is very important to our client


As an owner-managed company, our client can concentrate fully on the needs of its customers and employees.
Mutual appreciation and support, customer orientation and a down-to-earth attitude are among the core values and should also be your top priority.
Openness, friendliness and patience should be among your basic characteristics. You enjoy dealing and working with a wide variety of people - whether internally in a team or externally with customers.
At the same time, you will be given plenty of scope to contribute your expertise to the development of innovative solutions for customers.
Our client is proud of the fact that new team members often find their professional home in the company and stay on board for a long time.


What our client offers


Your onboarding is coordinated and supported by a dedicated team.
As part of your 40-hour week, you can look forward to flexible working hours that you can adapt to your individual rhythm of life.
It is possible to work remotely. However, you are of course also welcome in the office at the nearest location
You can choose from a wide range of work equipment such as notebooks and smartphones.
You can choose between a company car or a generous mobility allowance.
Well-equipped flex offices are available to consultants at each location.
Thanks to a wide range of training courses, most of which are held internally, you will always be up to date.
Two additional certifications per year
The values of respect, helpfulness and down-to-earthness, as well as flat hierarchies and the consistently appreciative atmosphere, make it easy for you to feel at home.
The owner-managed company is growing sustainably and sensibly, not only securing existing jobs, but also continuously creating new ones - like this one.


This is how it continues


Please apply directly online by clicking on the Apply for this job now button.
If you have any questions, please use the contact details of the contact person.
We will then arrange a telephone appointment for a short interview.
If you are interested, we will then introduce you to our client and guide you through the entire application process.


Would you like to switch? That's between us!

If you are in an employment relationship that has not been terminated, we will of course ensure that your application is treated with the utmost confidentiality.


We will only contact your current or former employer with your consent.
Telephone interviews and job interviews also after hours.


# Does that sound good? Then apply now. We look forward to hearing from you!
Show more

  • Solution-oriented handling of complex issues and independent driving force in the development of reporting tools.
  • Experience in working with customers and sound consulting skills.
  • Familiarity with ITIL processes and ensuring operations.

This position doesn't suit you?

The job advertisement doesn't match what you want? We are looking for IT consultants with a wide range of specializations. We would be happy to find out what we can do for you in an initial phone call. As we only place IT experts, we are constantly receiving new vacancies in this area. Perhaps we have something with other clients that better suits your plans and wishes.

This is very important to our client

  • As an owner-managed company, our client can concentrate fully on the needs of its customers and employees.
  • Mutual appreciation and support, customer orientation and a down-to-earth attitude are among the core values and should also be your top priority.
  • Openness, friendliness and patience should be among your basic characteristics. You enjoy dealing and working with a wide variety of people - whether internally in a team or externally with customers.
  • At the same time, you will be given plenty of scope to contribute your expertise to the development of innovative solutions for customers.
  • Our client is proud of the fact that new team members often find their professional home in the company and stay on board for a long time.

What our client offers

  • Your onboarding is coordinated and supported by a dedicated team.
  • As part of your 40-hour week, you can look forward to flexible working hours that you can adapt to your individual rhythm of life.
  • It is possible to work remotely. However, you are of course also welcome in the office at the nearest location
  • You can choose from a wide range of work equipment such as notebooks and smartphones.
  • You can choose between a company car or a generous mobility allowance.
  • Well-equipped flex offices are available to consultants at each location.
  • Thanks to a wide range of training courses, most of which are held internally, you will always be up to date.
  • Two additional certifications per year
  • The values of respect, helpfulness and down-to-earthness, as well as flat hierarchies and the consistently appreciative atmosphere, make it easy for you to feel at home.
  • The owner-managed company is growing sustainably and sensibly, not only securing existing jobs, but also continuously creating new ones - like this one.

This is how it continues

  • Please apply directly online by clicking on the Apply for this job now button.
  • If you have any questions, please use the contact details of the contact person.
  • We will then arrange a telephone appointment for a short interview.
  • If you are interested, we will then introduce you to our client and guide you through the entire application process.

Would you like to switch? That's between us!

If you are in an employment relationship that has not been terminated, we will of course ensure that your application is treated with the utmost confidentiality.

  • We will only contact your current or former employer with your consent.
  • Telephone interviews and job interviews also after hours.

# Does that sound good? Then apply now. We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We are Gemma Analytics: a Berlin-based company specializing in generating insights in high-performance data infrastructure. Gemma was founded in early 2020 by two data enthusiasts. Ever since we have helped over 60 companies to become more data-driven and successful. We have a fun, honest, and inclusive work environment. We are always looking for data-minded people we can learn from.

Tasks

As a Senior Data Analyst, your mission is to empower businesses with data-driven insights and strategies that propel their growth and success. You do not accept a solution, but ask for the “Why?”. You will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights, enabling our clients to make informed and trusted judgments and gain an advantage in their respective industries.

In addition to that, you will contribute to the growth of our organization by mentoring and guiding associate data professionals and sharing your knowledge and expertise to foster their professional development. Furthermore, you will responsibly stay abreast of the latest industry trends and technologies, continuously nurturing your skills and providing thought leadership and support within our company.

By embracing this mission, you will help businesses unlock the potential of their data, driving tangible results, sharing your knowledge with colleagues, and enthusiastically nurturing decision-making in a rapidly evolving digital landscape.

Requirements

We believe in a good mixture of experience and upside in our team. For this role, related experience is required in addition to a proof of trajectory.

Besides That We Are Looking For The Following


2 or more years of experience as an analyst in a fast-paced environment driving projects and business insights
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability for critical thinking and reflection
Strong interpersonal and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proven ability to manage multiple projects, meet deadlines, and adapt to changing priorities
Ability to leverage both SQL and visualization tools to generate insights for our clients
Business Fluency (C2 or native) in German or English
Preferred: You managed to bring a data science model to production
Preferred: You have strong expertise in one or more core functional data areas (e.g. product/marketing/operational/etc.)


Benefits

We are located in Berlin, close to Nordbahnhof. We are currently 17 colleagues and will grow to 23 colleagues in the next 12 to 18 months. Other perks include:


We are a hybrid company that meets in the office twice a week - one common office day and one flexible day
We allow for intra-EU workcations for up to 3 months a year (extra-EU workcations also if this is allowed)
We have an honest, inclusive work environment and want to nurture this environment
We don’t compromise on equipment - a powerful Laptop, extra screens, and all the tools you need to be effective
We will surround you with great people who love to solve (mostly data) riddles
We believe in efficient working hours rather than long working hours - we focus on the output rather than the input
We learn and share during meetups, lunch & learn sessions and are open to further initiatives
We pay a market-friendly salary and we additionally distribute at least 20% of profits to our employees
We are fast-growing and have technology at our core, yet we do not rely on a VC and operate profitably
We have a great yearly offsite event that brings us all together for a full week, enjoying good food, and having a good time (2021: Austria, 2022: Czech Republic, 2023: Germany)


How You'll Get Here


CV Screening
Phone/Coffee/Tea Initial Conversation
Hiring Test
Interviews with 3 future colleagues
Reference calls
Offer + Hired
Show more
