Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Marketing Science Partner

London Brock Street, 3 days onsite

9 months contract PAYE

Starting from £60 per hour

Job Ref: 57166




The Marketing Science Partner is a highly quantitative measurement professional, with marketing analytics experience to drive the Facebook measurement strategy with our largest Global Advertisers. To successfully influence how client’s conduct and use measurement, the role will need to be able to work cross-functionally with advertisers, sales teams, and other members of the Marketing Science team.




The ideal candidate will be passionate about advertising, intellectually curious, and able to move fast while keeping focused on high impact projects. This role requires a strong understanding of the media landscape and ability to apply quantitative techniques to understand consumer behavior and advertising effectiveness.




Marketing Science Partner Responsibilities:

- Drive our global advertisers to measure true business value by operationalizing analyses and research that will prove the value of Facebook’s advertising business.

- Play a strategic role in developing the cross-platform and cross-media measurement approaches and learning agendas for our global clients

- Conduct in-depth standard and custom ad effectiveness studies for global advertisers to understand the relative impact of different marketing strategies across digital platforms and across media

- Drive client, vertical, and industry adoption of learning & preferred measurement methodologies, products, and approaches

- Engage in senior client conversations, presentations of results, and consult internally with the sales teams to advise them on marketing best practices using evidence-based insights.

- Provide feedback to and collaborate with Product, R&D, and Partnerships teams to identify opportunities for new features, products, and partnerships




Requirements/Qualifications:

- Experience in research, analytics, or ad effectiveness

-Experience in working with SQL (essential), R & Python (preferred)

- An understanding of online advertising and familiarity with branding and performance advertising and marketing frameworks, including ad effectiveness measurement techniques

- Experience with statistical analysis, including but not limited to experimental design, modelling, or advertising research

- Experience building connections with customers and team members through effective communication and collaborating cross-functionally

- Comfortable communicating complex topics to a non-technical audience & experience of inspiring action based on data-driven insights including influencing advertiser planning and buying behavior

- A track record of operating independently, demonstrating creativity, being detail-oriented, and delivering results in a highly organized manner

Show more
HTML:
Marketing Science Partner

London Brock Street, 3 days onsite

9 months contract PAYE

Starting from £60 per hour

Job Ref: 57166


The Marketing Science Partner is a highly quantitative measurement professional, with marketing analytics experience to drive the Facebook measurement strategy with our largest Global Advertisers. To successfully influence how client’s conduct and use measurement, the role will need to be able to work cross-functionally with advertisers, sales teams, and other members of the Marketing Science team.


The ideal candidate will be passionate about advertising, intellectually curious, and able to move fast while keeping focused on high impact projects. This role requires a strong understanding of the media landscape and ability to apply quantitative techniques to understand consumer behavior and advertising effectiveness.


Marketing Science Partner Responsibilities:

- Drive our global advertisers to measure true business value by operationalizing analyses and research that will prove the value of Facebook’s advertising business.

- Play a strategic role in developing the cross-platform and cross-media measurement approaches and learning agendas for our global clients

- Conduct in-depth standard and custom ad effectiveness studies for global advertisers to understand the relative impact of different marketing strategies across digital platforms and across media

- Drive client, vertical, and industry adoption of learning & preferred measurement methodologies, products, and approaches

- Engage in senior client conversations, presentations of results, and consult internally with the sales teams to advise them on marketing best practices using evidence-based insights.

- Provide feedback to and collaborate with Product, R&D, and Partnerships teams to identify opportunities for new features, products, and partnerships


Requirements/Qualifications:

- Experience in research, analytics, or ad effectiveness

-Experience in working with SQL (essential), R & Python (preferred)

- An understanding of online advertising and familiarity with branding and performance advertising and marketing frameworks, including ad effectiveness measurement techniques

- Experience with statistical analysis, including but not limited to experimental design, modelling, or advertising research

- Experience building connections with customers and team members through effective communication and collaborating cross-functionally

- Comfortable communicating complex topics to a non-technical audience & experience of inspiring action based on data-driven insights including influencing advertiser planning and buying behavior

- A track record of operating independently, demonstrating creativity, being detail-oriented, and delivering results in a highly organized manner

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title:

Senior Data Analyst




Salary:

Circa £40,000 to £45,000 per annum plus generous benefits




Job Type:

Full Time, 35 Hours per week.




Accountable to:

Sales Manager with specific additional reporting line to the Chair and the Executive Team.




Location:

Hybrid (staff are required to attend the central London office at least once a week, or more depending on business demands)




Line Management:

Data Analyst




The post will have no formal budgetary responsibilities.




About the Company:

Registry Trust judgment data is an integral part of the economic ecosystem, promoting responsible lending and borrowing, and informed business decisions. The data also provides critical insights into the state of the economy and household finances. As a non-profit organisation, Registry Trust has a reputation as a trusted intermediary working with the main actors in the economic ecosystem – government, the court service, regulators, credit information providers, lenders and other service providers that use our data. Registry Trust is committed to driving innovation in the debt and credit sectors by providing data-driven insights that inform policy and business decisions. As the economy recovers from the cost of living crisis and the impact of Covid, the role of data in rebuilding household finances and shaping policies on consumer and small business debt will become even more critical. With this in mind, we are now seeking a highly motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our team, bringing advanced analytics, business insight expertise, and innovative thinking on the use of data to strengthen our market impact and support our commercial strategy. This role will also directly support our Public Data for the Public Good mission and data ambitions. We are particularly looking for someone with a creative mindset, capable of thinking outside the box, to help shape our future plans through insightful analysis and broader strategic thinking.




Role Overview:

This pivotal role involves leading a data analyst and collaborating closely with sales and marketing, and public affairs and campaign functions to drive data-driven initiatives that support business growth and overall organisation strategy. Reporting to the Sales Manager and engaging with the Executive Team, the role requires a deep understanding of Registry Trust's mission and sectors, strong attention to detail, and the ability to influence decisions.




Key Responsibilities:

Data-Driven Insights and Reporting: Utilise county court judgment and external financial and socio-economic data to produce reports on the UK economy, household finances, and financial vulnerability, delivering quarterly insights that inform consumer and small business policy in the debt and credit sectors.
Advanced Analytics and Data Integration: Use modelling software to generate accurate statistical outputs, integrate RTL data with other datasets, and ensure data quality and integrity in all reports.
Trend Analysis and Business Insight: Identify and analyse trends (such as changes in county court judgments, shifts in household debt levels, emerging patterns of financial vulnerability, and socio-economic impacts on small businesses) using RTL and external datasets.
Stakeholder Presentations and Marketing Support: Create tailored presentations and insights for senior stakeholders, including government bodies, financial services, and civil society organisations.
Collaboration and Commercial Growth: Collaborate with and support the wider senior management team to shape future design, commercial opportunities, and public policy priorities through enhanced data analysis and insights.
Team Leadership and Mentorship: Supervise, mentor, and inspire the data analyst team member, including managing guest analysts (e.g., interns and students).




Additional Responsibilities:

Build relationships with external stakeholders and provide data insights to senior leadership for informed decision-making.
Monitor industry trends and ensure compliance with ISMS and Data Protection regulations through regular audits.
Continuously improve processes for efficiency and communicate complex data clearly to diverse audiences.
Stay updated on financial services trends and emerging technologies to enhance business performance.




Qualifications and Skills:

The role requires a degree in a relevant field like Data Science, Economics, or Statistics, with a strong foundation in statistical analysis and data management. Candidates should have 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, proficiency in tools like R, Python, Tableau, and Power BI, and a proven ability to present insights to senior stakeholders. Team leadership experience and skills in data manipulation, integration, and compliance are also essential, alongside excellent communication, presentation, and project management capabilities to deliver impactful reports and insights aligned with business goals.




Reward and Benefits:

Healthy work/life balance – 35 hour work week, (at least one day in the office per week)
Private Medical Insurance – Bupa
Life Assurance
Income Protection
Pension – 10% employer contribution/5% employee contribution
Employee Benefits Platform
Bonus scheme linked to performance
Length of service awards
30 days annual leave
One paid day off for volunteering
Social and team building events




Equality, Diversity and Inclusion

Registry Trust is committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity, or marriage and civil partnership. We aspire to have a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply and join Registry Trust. Registry Trust is a proud member of the Disability confident employer scheme. A Disability Confident employer will offer an interview to any applicant that declares they have a disability and meets the minimum criteria (essential) for the job as defined in the person specification.




How to Apply

We hope you will consider making an application. To do so, please click on the apply now button, with your CV.




Application closing date:

16th October 2024 9am




First stage Interviews held face to face:

Thursday 24th October 2024




Start Date:

November/December 2024 - subject to references and notice period

Title: Market Data Analyst with Quantitative Trading Firm
Description:
We are working with one of our key clients, an established quantitative trading firm, who are looking to hire for a newly created Market Data Analyst position as they go through a period of growth.




The role will be fairly broad and technical, with the main focus being around improving data quality for the quantitative research teams. This will be an opportunity to work alongside some of the best in the industry, while improving your technical skills.




The ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of previous experience in a similar market data analyst role. Strong academics (i.e. STEM degree from a top university) and good Python & SQL skills are a prerequisite.




The company in question are known for being one of the higher paying in the industry, so are able to offer a good uplift on base/bonus for the right candidate.

Title: Transportation Data Analyst (Citymapper)
Description:
At Citymapper (powered by Via), we’re on a mission to help make complex cities more accessible to everyday users. Our application transports millions of people in hundreds of cities around the world by giving them access to the most current and sophisticated transportation options available. We make getting around your favorite city easy, so that you can enjoy the ride.

As a Transportation Data Analyst (French-speaking) at Citymapper, you will be managing the data that is the backbone of our application’s success. Y our work directly impacts our user experience, and is the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away, or reaching it just in time. Millions of users around the world trust our application to be on time for work, a job interview, or a date - and we take great responsibility in fulfilling that need.

This is a hybrid role that can be done from either London, Paris, Berlin or Amsterdam.

What You'll Do:


You will help to manage the timetable data that powers the Citymapper application. Using proprietary tools and methods, you will transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information.
You will build, validate and ship data to production on a daily basis.
You will manage data in a range of cities and across different formats.
You will work with our engineers to build for scale by improving tools and automating tasks.
You will ensure data quality in our web and mobile products so that users continue to love and trust Citymapper.


Who You Are:


Fluent in French (C1-level or above)
You have a passion for public transportation and cities, and an interest in how public transportation networks operate.
You are comfortable dealing with large data sets, and have an eagerness to learn new data skills.
You take a hands-on, practical, pragmatic attitude to your work.
You have exceptional attention to detail, and an ability to communicate those details to other collaborators.
You have up to 3 years of experience working with data, Python and/or common transit data formats (GTFS, TransXChange, Siri, Hafas, etc).


What We Offer:


Becoming part of Via, a company that was awarded for its commitment to social good
Joining the team working on the industry-leading mobile app that is loved and trusted by millions of users
State of the art hardware for you to perform your work worry free
Ongoing support and training to ensure you have the resources you need to thrive and progress in your career
Competitive salary and comprehensive health scheme offered through AXA
A hybrid or remote work model. Remote work is possible if you're based in one of these countries: England, Germany or Netherlands


Founded in 2012, Via pioneered the TransitTech category by using new technologies to develop public mobility systems — optimizing networks of buses, shuttles, wheelchair accessible vehicles, school buses, autonomous vehicles, and electric vehicles around the globe.Building the world's most efficient, equitable, and sustainable transportation network for all passengers — including those with limited mobility, those without smartphones, and unbanked populations — Via works with its partners to lower the costs of public transit while providing transportation options that rival the convenience of a personal car while reducing environmental impact.

At the intersection of transportation and technology, Via is a visionary market leader that combines software innovation with sophisticated service design and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves, providing technology in 650 communities and more than 35 countries and counting.

We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated at Via.Ready to join the ride? Via is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Analyst Apprentice
Description:
Job Description

An apprentice data analyst is responsible for collecting, inputting and outputting data, cleaning and preparing it for analysis, and creating basic reports and visualisations. They support more experienced analysts in modelling data and may also be involved in basic programming tasks. As they gain experience, apprentices are expected to learn new tools and techniques and take on more complex responsibilities in the field of data analysis. Duties may include:


Identify data sources to meet the organisation's requirements using evidence-based decision making to create various data.
Collaborating/working with clients and colleagues to determine reporting needs and deliver accurate information.
Collect, compile and, if needed, cleanse data. Solving any problems that arise from a range of internal and external systems.
Generate performance dashboards and reports during the Visualisation and Model Building phase.
Maintain and develop reports for analysis, ensuring compliance with organisational policies and legislation.
Create standard and non-standard statistical and data analysis reports
Analyse and interpret data trends and patterns, drawing conclusions and providing guidance for understanding.
Summarise and present data analysis results to stakeholders, offering recommendations.
Ensure data storage and archiving align with relevant legislation, such as GDPR.
Using databases including PowerBI, Python and Excel.
Using programme languages such as SQL, HTML, JSONS etc.


Typical Working Week

40 hours p/w with start time typically between 07:00 & 08:00 inclusive of paid 8 hours at college.

Person Specification


Proactive approach, taking pride in their work and taking accountability for decisions.
A love of variety in a role and ability to adapt to a dynamic, fast-paced working environment
Ability to quickly prioritise tasks and the initiative to dive head-first into problem solving
No two days are the same on the front line and not every day goes to plan, so you'll need to be quick on your feet to respond!
Excellent communication and collaboration skills and enjoy working with multiple teams
Ability to analyse and interpret information and effectively communicate this to different team members and audiences
Ability to visit different sites and training days
Curiosity to learn quickly in a reactive and dynamic working environment.
Ability to work in all weather conditions to serve our customers and protect the environment
Able to understand and follow health and safety protocols


Qualifications Required/desirable

Minimum Requirements

English and Maths at GCSE Grade 4 / C or above, or Functional Skills at Level 2 or above.

Desired Requirements

A high interest in developing your knowledge and understanding of key concepts and techniques that help organisations effectively use data to make decisions

Key Training/College Information

K10 will enrol you to the Level 4 Data Analyst course and fund your qualifications through an accredited training provider.

The apprenticeship duration is 24 months.

Eligibility

To Start This Apprenticeship, You'll Need To Be


Living in England for the last 3 years and have right to work status
Not enrolled on any other courses
18+ due to site H&S rules


Who We Are

We are UK's largest construction-specific Flexi-Job Apprenticeship Agency. Founded in 2009, we are an award-winning social enterprise with a passion to convert potential.

Our aim is to place our learners in sustainable employment on projects in their local area. To do this, we collaborate with government, referral organisations, local authorities, developers, contractors, and colleges, to deliver apprenticeship programmes specifically designed to upskill the future of construction.

Title: Data Processing Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Processing Analyst

Location: Central London, hybrid working

Employment Type: 3-6 month FTC

Reports to: Growth and Lead Generation Analyst

We're looking for a Data Processing Analyst to join our team on a 3-6 month fixed term contract.

Our Mission

Would you agree that our health is the most precious thing we have? And that each patient should be empowered to make confident decisions on their healthcare?

Doctify is a global patient platform, operating in 6 markets. We are building the largest, most impactful global healthcare platform, uniting the healthcare community around the world behind patient voices.

Our mission is to help over 100 million patients by 2025. If this sounds like a mission you would like to be a part of, then apply now!

You'll Be Responsible For


Managing multiple projects on data acquisition, cleaning, formatting and enrichment
Working with third party suppliers to improve our data
Rigorously checking the data we have, data that we acquire, ensuring it's filled correctly, and that it's accurate, and helpful to patients



About You


You will have a strong knowledge of how to collect, manage and analyse large data sets
You will have over 2 years' experience working within a similar position
You will have experience in project management
You will have experience working with Excel and Data entry techniques
You will have an interest in computer science and/or work in large date data sets
You will have experience with Salesforce and HubSpot, desirable but not required
You thrive working in a fast-moving, agile environment and love a challenge



Our Commitment To Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging. They're more than just buzz-words for us. Our commitment to these values is steadfast and they are an integral part of how we create what is Uniquely Doctify in our ways of working, policies and processes, building our teams and ultimately, bringing our mission to life.

We will always embrace uniqueness - so bring your whole self to Doctify!

More About Doctify

Doctify was launched in 2015 by Stephanie Eltz and Suman Saha, who met as trainee surgeons, to address the lack of a trusted or transparent online platform for patient reviews. While the likes of TripAdvisor, Trustpilot, and Glassdoor had enabled consumers around the world to search easily for verified feedback on products, services, and experiences, this model had yet to cut through in global healthcare.

Backed by transatlantic venture capital firm, Beringea, leading European investment funds Amadeus Capital Partners, Keen Ventures as well as investors such as Sir John Hegarty (founder of Saatchi & Saatchi), and Tom Teichmann (early investor in Lastminute.com, Notonthehighstreet.com, Made.com and Simba Sleep). To date, Doctify has raised over 30 million US dollars of investment.

Doctify was launched in 2015 by Stephanie Eltz and Suman Saha, who met as trainee surgeons, to address the lack of a trusted or transparent online platform for patient reviews. While the likes of TripAdvisor, Trustpilot, and Glassdoor had enabled consumers around the world to search easily for verified feedback on products, services, and experiences, this model had yet to cut through in global healthcare.

Backed by transatlantic venture capital firm, Beringea, leading European investment funds Amadeus Capital Partners, Keen Ventures as well as investors such as Sir John Hegarty (founder of Saatchi & Saatchi), and Tom Teichmann (early investor in Lastminute.com, Notonthehighstreet.com, Made.com and Simba Sleep). To date, Doctify has raised over 30 million US dollars of investment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
hackajob is a matching platform partnering with Virgin Media helping them to hire the best talent and build the future. To get the chance to get matched to this role and other similar roles, click on Apply to set up your free profile.




Virgin Media O2 is at the start of a new era. As one of the UK’s largest businesses, they are powered by an epic, diverse and high-performing team that provide customers with a range of services they love to use and rely on every day. Make their customers your priority and they’ll make you theirs. With incredible job opportunities, unbelievable perks and an inclusive can-do culture, are you ready to be part of the change?




Job description

This is a 6 Month fixed term contract




They are looking for a technical Business Analyst to support in the delivery of each initiative from within their Product team, drawing out key technical details and identifying areas of improvement through analytical thinking and problem solving. You’ll be owning business requirements & interfacing into the business, to ensure that objectives are covered in sprints. You’ll assist in all aspects of delivery and be able to link this to benefit realisation and where necessary in planning/ideation.




This will be an instrumental role as part of relatively new team. You’ll report into the Lifecycle Lead and help them to oversee full delivery of their strategy and goals.




The successful candidate must evidence experience of operating at pace, with ambiguity and be comfortable dealing with fast-moving, rapidly changing priorities as part of high-performing team.




This role offers a unique opportunity to join a team of forward-thinking innovators who are determined to reshape the way their company serves its customers. They're not just rethinking products and services—we're challenging legacy ways of working and driving a culture of "get stuff done." Their mission is to develop new offerings to the evolving needs of their customers.




If you thrive in fast-paced environments, love breaking barriers, and are ready to think outside the box, this is the role where you'll learn and grow like never before.




Who they are




The UK’s fastest broadband network. The nation’s best-loved mobile brand. And, one of the UK's biggest companies too.




Diverse, high performing teams - jam packed with serious talent. Together, they offer the UK more choice and better value, through their boundary-pushing, customer-championing values and ambitions.




Together, they are Virgin Media O2, and they can't wait to see what you can do.




Accessible, inclusive and equitable for all




Virgin Media O2 is an equal opportunities employer and they're working hard to remove bias and barriers for their people and candidates. So, they build equity and inclusion into everything they do, from the policies they craft to the relationships they shape. They support and encourage you to be your authentic self throughout your application journey with us.




The must haves




In order to be considered, you must have the following experience;




Strong technical skills with proven experience in translating business requirements to technical requirements, with the ability to refine and understand technical complexity and playback to business stakeholders

Strong stakeholder management skills

Experience of building, refining and prioritising an agile backlog

Tenacious, goal and result oriented, with the ability to deliver within tight timescales

Experience of operating at pace, with ambiguity and be comfortable dealing with fast-moving, rapidly changing priorities

Customer focused with the ability to identify customer experience issues and drive solutions




The other stuff they are looking for

They'd also love you to bring:




Experience in e-commerce care, sales or subscription management




What's in it for you




Their goal is to celebrate their people, their lives and everything in-between. They aim to create a culture that empowers everyone to bring the best versions of themselves to work each and every day. They believe the most inclusive and diverse culture makes for a better business and a brighter world!




Working at Virgin Media O2, you get a bumper reward package bursting with benefits, and loads of extras you can add if you’d like to. These are designed to support both you and your loved ones, making sure that you’re covered no matter what life throws your way.




Next steps




If they feel like a place where you can belong, they'd love to learn more about you as a person and your experience to date. Once you've submitted an application the next steps of the process, if successful, are likely to include a call from one of their Talent Acquisition Partners.




When you apply, you'll be asked about any adjustments you might need to support the recruitment process. Let them know, and they'll be sure to discuss it with you.




Please note: Applications will be reviewed, and interviews conducted throughout the duration of this advert, therefore they may bring the closing date forward. They encourage all interested applicants to apply as soon as possible. If you’re offered a job with them, it will be conditional, based on the passing of background checks. All roles require a criminal record check and some roles need a financial probity check. Your recruiter can provide you with more information if needed.




Thanks for your patience and for showing an interest in joining the Virgin Media O2 family.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
SQL Data Analyst- Healthcare




Aarista Technology is proprietary and vertically integrated technology EMR solutions enable providers to enhance medication adherence through improved access, owned physician network, information sharing, data analytics, and customizable insights.




We are looking for an experience SQL Data Analyst specializing in writing SQL and understanding healthcare data. This person will play a key role on the core product and development team that is working on building our next generation suite of EMR products. As a member of our core product and development team, this person will contribute significantly to the business and clinical requirements designing and implementing various product features using agile methodologies.




Your Role

Full understanding of Aarista Datasets.
Perform impact analysis of existing datasets and new datasets
Collaborate with various teams and other stakeholders build queries to meet requirements.
Test and validate.
Brainstorm with your team to conceptualize and build new features.

You

You are the expert with writing queries using Azure SQL
You have a good knowledge and understanding of relational data modelling methodologies
You are a motivated, enthusiastic person looking for a rewarding position with a great innovative startup and want to achieve big things with us.
You thrive in a team environment but can also work independently.
You are passionate about using your knowledge and skills to solve real healthcare problems and are motivated by understanding the value that your work adds.
A self-starter that can manage their own workload and an ever-growing task list.
A team player and leader.
Problem solving of potential roadblocks which could potentially impact patient care, strategic, and technical goals of the business.
Consistently meeting timelines and deliverables.

Skills Recent experience with healthcare datasets and expert in writing SQL in Azure SQL and/or SQL Server environments




Job Types: Full-time currently hybrid but could change to full-time in office based on companies’ decision.




Pay: Competitive pay and benefits and valuable startup stock options

Title: Data Analyst/Data Engineer
Description:
About TCS:




Tata Consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile™ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS has over 615,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 55 countries. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $27.9 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2023, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.




Skills and Responsibilities:

• Good years of experience in Data Analyst/Data Engineer.

•Experience in data visualization, data cleaning, data manipulation (extract, transform, load), and tool usage of Tableau, Talend, SSIS.

•Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.

•Databases - MS SQL/Oracle/Teradata

•Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret complex data.

•Experience in performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.

•Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.

•A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large datasets.

•Excellent communication abilities in English communication skill, in written and oral.

•Roles & Responsibilities - [Data analysis] Define and specify data analysis target and support modeling / verification / test / application.

•[Data-based decision making] Research and support the insight to support decision making in the areas of business direction/market strategy/product strategy.

•[Verification of decision effects] Support methods to verify the effect of decision on business.

•[Algorithms acidization] Support implementing, evaluating and verifying algorithms for data analysis.

•Excellent communication skills

•Continuous learning attitude

•Team worker

•Meticulous Education bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or related technical skills.




Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualification for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.

Title: BI Analyst II
Description:
Are you excited about building analytics products that drive business impact? If yes, the business intelligence analyst role is just right for you! 

As a business intelligence analyst on the data and analytics team, you will work closely with a group of analytics professionals and both technology and business stakeholders at Best Buy, to create personalized, meaningful, and respectful relationships with our customers at each stage of their shopping journey.

We practice a remote first working model, leveraging in-person interactions at our head office in beautiful Vancouver, BC, for strategic, collaborative, and social purposes.

Join our innovative data and analytics team as a BI Analyst II!

What you'll do:


Build executive and operational dashboards that help the enterprise track performance, get insights and find new opportunities to serve our customers better
Drive ad-hoc investigations and analyses to address business questions, evaluate new business opportunities, process improvements, and operational changes
Support cloud migration of data and reports to Azure Data Lake, Fabric, Powerbi.com
Develop and maintain critical data flows, ETLs, and other analytic products, consolidating data from various sources.
Provide analytics thought leadership in a high-profile project that significantly impacts business.
Partner with business leaders and stakeholders to find creative solutions.


What we're looking for:


4+ years of experience in data analytics with strong stakeholder management skills, including business intelligence development, ETL and descriptive analysis.
Advanced Proficiency with programming languages such as Python (data analytics use cases, data pipelining, reporting, API), SQL and database management (e.g., work with DB objects, creating tables, views, stored procedures, functions, optimization) and DAX, maintaining and building Power BI dashboards
Experience with visualization and data modeling design and tools.
Experience working with loud services like Microsoft ADLS and Synapse, and knowledge of Snowflake and Fabric.
Fast and Independent learner with an agile mindset on delivering value iteratively and adapting quickly to change.
Bachelor's degree in computer science, information systems, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).


Why you'll love it here:


Remote-first work environment
Employee discounts on awesome tech from day one
Flexible health benefits and wellness program
TFSA and RRSP programs
100% matched company pension plan
Training programs to build new and transferable skills


About Best Buy

As Canada's destination for the coolest tech, Best Buy offers one of the best work environments in the country! Annually recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers, our culture is one of inclusivity and belonging and provides employees an environment where they can bring their whole selves to work.

Join our amazing team!

We are looking for people just like you.

Annualized base pay range

$87,000.00 - $97,000.00

This role is overtime eligible.

Starting pay offered will consider skills and experience. Your pay can grow as you build your career with us.

Suite 102 - 425 West 6th Avenue, Vancouver, BC V5Y 1L3

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Description

We are looking for a talented Business Intelligence Analyst- Hybrid to join our team specializing in Marketing for our Distribution Business Unit in Surrey, BC or at one of our sites across Canada.

Job Summary

Responsible for the preparation of Business Intelligence (BI) analyses and reports for key stakeholders.

In this role, you will make an impact in the following ways:


Gather and analyze reporting requirements to provide accurate and timely recurring reports.
Perform quality assurance and validate conclusions to ensure the reliability of your analysis.
Select the most appropriate analysis methods to address specific issues or problems.
Deliver recurring reports and analyses to stakeholders punctually.
Extract and interpret data from operational systems and databases to support decision-making.
Utilize globally standardized dashboards and best reporting practices to meet BI needs.
Collaborate with senior BI analysts and leaders to understand and fulfill end-user requirements.
Communicate effectively with key stakeholders to ensure clarity and alignment on analysis and reporting.


Responsibilities

To be successful in this role you will need the following:


Communicates effectively: Develop and deliver clear, multi-mode communications tailored to different audiences’ needs.
Nimble learning: Learn actively through experimentation, using both successes and failures as learning opportunities.
Self-development: Seek new ways to grow and be challenged through formal and informal development channels.
Tech savvy: Anticipate and adopt innovations in digital and technology applications for business growth.
Data Analytics: Discover, interpret, and communicate data insights, applying statistics, data visualization, and problem-solving to support data-driven decisions.
Data Quality: Identify, understand, and correct data flaws to ensure effective information governance and decision-making.
Values differences: Recognize and appreciate the value of diverse perspectives and cultures within the organization.
Action oriented: Approach new opportunities and challenges with urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm


Education, Licenses, Certifications

College, university, or equivalent bachelor’s degree in Data sciences, or in Economics, Computer Science, or Statistics / relevant field with a quantitative focus, or experience equivalent is required.

This position may require licensing for compliance with export controls or sanctions regulations.

Experience

Experience analyzing data and developing clear and accurate conclusions required. Experience supporting a customer-focused organization preferred.

Qualifications

This role will be responsible for creating and maintaining critical BI views for CSSNA Powergen, using Microsoft PowerBI, Salesforce CPQ, and other query languages to integrate our business intelligence into a leadership view.

Areas In Scope Of BI


Sales / ordering / COR
Inventory
Product health
Supply planning, upstream & downstream vendors
Nonstock vendor inventory
Partnered inventory cycle times


Education in Business Analytics, Data Visualization, Software Development, Computer Science, Microsoft PowerBI required.

University or applied experience creating databases, BI, and Data Visualization preferred.

Compensation And Benefits

Base salary rate commensurate with experience. Additional benefits vary between locations and include options such as our Company Pension Plan, Medical/Dental/Life Insurance, and a full complement of personal and professional benefits.

At Cummins, we are committed to the principles of diversity and employment equity under the Employment Equity Act, and we strive to ensure that our workforce reflects the diverse nature of Canadian society.

Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, gender, color, disability, national origin, age, religion, union affiliation, sexual orientation, veteran status, citizenship, gender identity and/or expression, or other status protected by law.

The successful candidate will be subject to our Pre-Employment Background Screening process that consists of a Criminal Background Check.

Job Sales

Organization Cummins Inc.

Role Category Hybrid

Job Type Exempt - Experienced

Min Salary $67200

Max Salary $100800

ReqID 2402292

Relocation Package No

Title: Data Entry Analyst (Entry-Level) (Rebel Apparel)
Description:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Data Entry Analyst to join our team. This entry-level role is perfect for individuals eager to start a career in data analysis and management.

Key Responsibilities


Accurately input and update data into various systems and databases.
Review and clean data to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Assist in generating and analyzing reports based on data trends.
Collaborate with team members to resolve data discrepancies and issues.
Maintain organized records and documentation for easy retrieval.
Support data-related projects and tasks as assigned by supervisors.


Qualifications


High school diploma or equivalent; associate’s degree or coursework in data management is a plus.
Basic proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word).
Strong attention to detail and commitment to data accuracy.
Good organizational skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks.
Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work independently and meet deadlines.
Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace if remote.


Preferred Skills (Not Required)


Familiarity with data analysis tools or software.
Previous experience in a data entry or analytical role.


What We Offer


Competitive salary.
Flexible work hours and remote work options.
Comprehensive training and career development opportunities.
Supportive work environment with opportunities for growth.

Title: Data Analyst - Engineering Operations (Remote)
Description:
Overview

We are partnering with a SaaS Client to hire for a Data Analyst to the Engineering Operations team. The ideal candidate has a passion for translating data into meaningful insights, ability to identify invalid data, while ensuring data accuracy and consistency. This person thrives in ambiguity, is energized by a fast-paced work environment and can comfortably juggle a diverse array of responsibilities. They don't shy away from ambiguity and thrive in a fast paced, fluid environment where work responsibilities can change quickly. The core focus for this assignment will be on: Incident management reporting.


Contract Duration: 6+ Months
Hourly Rate: $55 - $65/hour
Location: Remote (must be located in Canada)
Must be able to work in Canada without sponsorship.
JQL experience is required!!


Responsibilities

Data Collection, Cleaning and Processing:


Assist in gathering, cleaning, and organizing datasets from various sources.
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and completeness.


Data Analysis


Utilize statistical methods and data visualization tools to identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Utilize SQL to manipulate data.


Reporting And Visualization


Generate reports and visualizations to communicate data insights.
Contribute to the creation of dashboards in Tableau and Jira for various stakeholders.


Documentation


Document data analysis processes, findings, and recommendations.
Maintain organized records of datasets and analyses.


Qualifications


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
Proficient in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., SQL, JQL).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Detail-oriented with a focus on data accuracy.
Strong expertise with Tableau server
Strong expertise with Jira
Education: Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Business Analytics).


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or other non-merit factor. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Remote Data Analyst (Rebel Apparel)
Description:
Job Title: Remote Data Analyst

Location: Remote

Job Type: Full-Time/Part-Time/Contract

Overview: We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Remote Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, statistical methods, and data visualization. This role is responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques, and providing ongoing reports. You will work closely with various teams to support data-driven decision-making processes.

Key Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and preprocess data from multiple sources.
Perform exploratory data analysis and develop predictive models.
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize trends and key metrics.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in complex datasets.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy across all reports and analyses.


Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, or R.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms.
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present findings clearly and effectively.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks efficiently.


Benefits


Competitive salary and performance bonuses.
Flexible working hours and remote work.
Professional development opportunities.
Health, dental, and vision insurance options.
Collaborative and inclusive work environment.


Application Process: To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and skills. We look forward to reviewing your application!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Be a part of ALTEA Healthcare growth, where we're reshaping the landscape of outpatient care and creating a space where innovation fosters better patient experiences and optimal health outcomes. Our mission is to bring hospital-quality technology, skilled clinicians, and value-based care management into the post-acute world.




At the heart of our transformative approach lies our proprietary technology platform, Aarista. This cutting-edge platform has garnered recognition for its exceptional ability to reduce the overall cost of care while proactively elevating patient outcomes. Powered by artificial intelligence, unique clinical insights, and real-time data analytics, Aarista drives our connected model, enabling us to deliver unparalleled healthcare solutions.




Join the team that is redefining healthcare!




Role: Senior Data Analyst

We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Data Analyst with a minimum of 5 years of proven experience in a similar role. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, excellent problem-solving skills, and a passion for transforming data into actionable insights. As a Data Analyst at ALTEA HealthCare, you will play a key role in driving data-driven decision-making and contributing to the overall success of the organization.




Responsibilities:

Data Collection and Analysis:

· Collect and analyze large and complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights.

· Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.

Data Wrangling, Cleaning, and Preprocessing:

· Work with large and complex datasets, performing data wrangling, cleaning, and preprocessing tasks.

· Ensure the accuracy and reliability of data through meticulous cleaning and validation processes.

Reporting and Visualization:

· Create clear and concise reports and dashboards to communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

· Work with business teams to understand reporting requirements and provide data-driven solutions.

Statistical Analysis:

· Conduct statistical analysis to support business decisions and validate hypotheses.

· Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and execute experiments.

Data Integration and Warehousing:

· Proven ability to perform data warehousing, cleaning, and integration tasks.

· Experience with writing scripts for automatically pulling data using APIs.




Qualifications:

· Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.

· Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.

· Expert in data analysis tools and advanced level proficiency in SQL programming language.

· Hands-on experience in Python and familiarity with data analysis libraries, such as Pandas, NumPy, and Plotly.

· Proficiency in writing scripts for pulling data using APIs or ETL tools.

· In-depth knowledge of Excel.

· Proven experience and proficient with data visualization tools specifically Power BI.

· Fluent with DAX and M Code.

· Strong data storytelling skills and visualization experience.

· Strong understanding of data modeling and Microsoft Fabric.

· Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings in a clear and understandable manner.

· Attention to detail and ability to work independently.

· Excellent collaborator with the ability to build and maintain strong relationships both within the team and with cross-functional stakeholders.

· Proven experience to act as a mentor and support junior-level Data Analysts on the team.

· Independent thinker who takes initiative and approaches problem-solving with an innovative mindset, focusing on scalable solutions.




Additional Skills:

· Having experience of working with Microsoft Suite.

· Familiarity with Agile tools such as Azure DevOps, GitHub, and SharePoint.

· Proficiency in using Jupyter for data analysis and visualization.

· Experience working with large and complex datasets; expertise in data wrangling, cleaning, preprocessing, and warehousing.

· Ability to write scripts for automatically pulling data using APIs.

Preferred Qualifications:

· Master's degree in a relevant field would be an asset.




Salary: 80K CAD above depending on experience

Title: Remote Data Analyst (Rebel Apparel)
Description:
Job Description: Rebel Apparel Inc. is seeking a skilled Remote Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques, and providing ongoing reports. Your primary focus will be to develop, implement, and maintain databases, data collection systems, and analytics tools that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. The ideal candidate will have a strong ability to analyze trends and provide actionable insights to enhance decision-making processes across the organization.

Responsibilities


Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.


Requirements


Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects, etc.), databases (SQL, etc.), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks), and data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, or Statistics.


Preferred Qualifications


Proven experience working in an e-commerce or retail environment.
Advanced degree in a related field.
Certification in Data Analytics.


Join Rebel Apparel Inc. and help us redefine the future of fashion through data-driven insights and innovation. Apply now to become a part of our passionate team!

Title: Social Media Analyst, Data & Intelligence
Description:
Hill & Knowlton is a strategic and creative partner to drive breakthrough opportunities for growth and value creation, advance corporate strategy, and build reputation capital and resiliency. We’re a proven partner for business and brand transformation. A full-service global firm, we provide strategic communication, marketing and corporate affairs solutions distinguished by intelligence and creativity. Hill & Knowlton is part of the Burson Group and WPP (NYSE: WPP), the creative transformation company. 

Wednesday to Sunday working hours

THE ROLE:

The Social Media Analyst will be an integral part of social intelligence / media monitoring work Hill & Knowlton delivers for its clients. Your meticulous and detail-oriented mindset will be essential as you analyze social media content, transforming raw data into actionable insights and contributing to a growing body of knowledge on issues and trends. Please note that this specific job posting is for afternoon-to-early evenings shifts working Wednesday to Sunday. Regular days off would be Monday and Tuesday.

The ideal candidate possesses an unwavering commitment to accuracy and a keen eye for detail, coupled with an understanding of social media analytics and trends. This role demands an intrinsic curiosity and a passion for uncovering insights from data. Additionally, this role involves leveraging WPP’s suite of Generative AI technologies to explore the automation of typical social intelligence responsibilities.

The role will ideally be based in Vancouver, but candidates based near one of Burson’s other Western Canada locations will also be considered.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze social media data: Evaluate our clients’ and competitors’ presence across social media and identify opportunities to protect and promote their brand.
Point of expertise: Our teams use a variety of media intelligence tools, like Brandwatch, Meltwater and Cision (among others). Previous experience is preferred and you would be upskilled to become an expert with these tools.
Data storytelling: We do more than provide data, we distill information to meaningful insights and strategies. Being an effective writer, with the desire to produce high-quality, insightful analysis is key to this role.
Client Insight: We're driven by a deep understanding of our clients' needs, often anticipating challenges and opportunities before they arise. You'll use your analytical skills to uncover insights within social media data that directly impact our clients' success.


Critical Experience

As the Social Media Analyst, you will have:


1-to-3 years of experience in public relations, social monitoring, or strategic communications – agency (PR, advertising, or marketing) experience is an asset though not required.
Analytical thinking and the ability to turn complex problems into an actionable research plan.
Experiencing using any of the following media intelligence platforms (e.g., Brandwatch, Cision, Meltwater, Quid, OPoint).
Meticulous attention to detail.
Experience developing queries with Boolean logic.
Strong understanding of typical social media metrics, including Reach, Impressions, Engagement, Share of Voice, etc.


Hill & Knowlton is more than an agency. It’s a collection of thousands of brilliant, collaborative and driven employees – all united around a single vision of transforming our clients, our company and the world.

Across 70 offices in 30 countries our people are the heartbeat of our business. Bridging countless cultures, backgrounds and lived experiences, we are drawn together by a common drive and a collaborative spirit – called to our craft each day by the desire to deliver the best work.  

And at H&K, diversity, equity and inclusion are not just values; they are strategic imperatives that fuel our future in an industry built on the art of understanding, connecting and developing relationships. We believe that a diverse workforce is essential for inspiring bold ideas, fostering constructive dialogue and cultivating meaningful experiences that drive innovation and creativity.

When you click the "Submit Application" button below, this will send any information you add below to Burson. Before you do this, we think it's a good idea to read through our Recruitment Privacy Policy. California residents should read our California Recruitment Privacy Notice. This explains what we do with your personal data when you apply for a role with us, and, how you can update the information you have provided us with or how to remove it.

Title: Geoscience Data Analyst
Description:
Be part of something incredible. Metals are necessary for our world, but mining historically faced issues with waste, sustainability, and inefficiencies. MineSense is changing that. Our solutions reduce mining waste and environmental impacts while increasing profits and efficiencies. Backed by the best in venture capital and government funds, and recognized by tech industry and sustainability programs, MineSense is doing what many said could not be done: improving mining for people and planet.




We are looking to add a Geoscience Data Analyst to our GeoScience team. The role will report to the Manager, GeoScience and be based out of the Vancouver office. The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in detailed data analysis and statistics within the mining industry. You will work with clients globally, to incorporate MineSense solutions into their ore control processes and show them the value of using our systems. If you enjoy working with data, collaborating with multidisciplinary groups, and have a mining, geology, or geophysics background, we want to hear from you!




Job Responsibilities

Helping new and existing clients leverage MineSense technology in their grade control engineering processes, which includes developing client facing reports and presentations.
Collaborating with internal teams to develop prediction models by correlating mine grade measurements or estimates with our sensor results to identify patterns, trends or other data features that relate to grade, texture, mineralogy, or lithology.
Working with the Field Service and Product Development team to further enhance our products and services through system data analysis and data quality assurance/control.
Determining and tracking data model accuracy and precision through comparison with sampled assay grades or grade estimates.
Reporting and presenting data results/trends to internal teams, as well as external clients.
Working closely with the Data team to create queries, scripts, and reports while ensuring data is well organized and maintained.
Building and maintaining good working relationships with our clients.
Promotes a positive company culture through sharing of information and supporting the learning and development of all colleagues.
Additional duties as occasionally required by your manager.







Qualifications




Degree in Earth Sciences (Geology, Geophysics), Geostatistics, Data Analytics, Mining Engineering or related field.
Ideally 1 to 4 years of relevant working experience, where experience in mining is preferred.
Experience performing statistical analysis or data science in a work setting is preferred.
Mining experience with in-grade control or working with ore control models is preferred.
Experience with data analysis tools such as Python or other statistical packages.
Experience and passion for solving analytical problems involving diverse data sets using quantitative approaches to generate insights.
Attention to detail and an interest in problem-solving.
Oral and written proficiency in English is required.
Additional oral and written proficiency in Spanish is an asset.
The ability to travel and support global offices is required (10-30%).
Legally able to work in Canada.




Salary Range: CAD 76000 - CAD 110000







The salary offered to the successful candidate will be based on their experience, knowledge and skills they bring to MineSense, market data based on their location as well as internal equity. Keeping this mind, the salary offered can be outside of the range posted. We are looking for talented folks at all levels, so please do not hesitate to apply.




Our total rewards package includes:

· A competitive bonus.

· Matching RRSP or 401K program (for Canadian and US employees)

· A comprehensive benefit program

· Transit Subsidy (for roles based in Vancouver, BC)

· Hybrid work (for roles that do not require to be onsite)

· 3 weeks' vacation or more depending on the position

· Company organized social events and celebrations to connect with your team







Here's what you can expect as a part of the MineSense Team:




When you join MineSense, a trailblazing Canadian mining technology company, you become a part of our purpose to maximize global metals and minimize global impacts. We’re not just a company; we’re a Community of Innovators who forge a path toward a sustainable future. Here’s why we want you to be excited:

· Purpose-Driven: At MineSense, we don’t just clock in—we live our purpose. We’re on a mission to revolutionize the mining industry, and every day, we’re one step closer to a cleaner, greener world.

· Values That Resonate: Our core values—Innovation, Belonging, Resilience, and Adding Value—aren’t just buzzwords. They’re the bedrock of our culture. When you step into our team, you’re not just an employee; you’re a steward of these values.

· Impactful Work: Imagine contributing to a cleaner, more sustainable planet. At MineSense, you’re shaping the future of cleantech and developing cutting edge technology that literally hasn't been developed before. Your work matters, and it echoes beyond our walls.

· People-Centric: We’re not just about profits; we’re about people. Our organization cares deeply about its employees. When you join us, you become part of a community that supports growth, well-being, and success.




Ready to make your mark? Join MineSense and be part of something bigger than yourself.

MineSense is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing accommodation to individuals with disabilities. Should you require accommodation during the recruitment or hiring process, please contact us at careers@minesense.com for assistance. Information received related to accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

All applications are welcome, even if you don't meet all the requirements, so please do not hesitate to apply.

Show more
HTML:
Be part of something incredible. Metals are necessary for our world, but mining historically faced issues with waste, sustainability, and inefficiencies. MineSense is changing that. Our solutions reduce mining waste and environmental impacts while increasing profits and efficiencies. Backed by the best in venture capital and government funds, and recognized by tech industry and sustainability programs, MineSense is doing what many said could not be done: improving mining for people and planet.


We are looking to add a Geoscience Data Analyst to our GeoScience team. The role will report to the Manager, GeoScience and be based out of the Vancouver office. The ideal candidate will have a strong interest in detailed data analysis and statistics within the mining industry. You will work with clients globally, to incorporate MineSense solutions into their ore control processes and show them the value of using our systems. If you enjoy working with data, collaborating with multidisciplinary groups, and have a mining, geology, or geophysics background, we want to hear from you!


Job Responsibilities

  • Helping new and existing clients leverage MineSense technology in their grade control engineering processes, which includes developing client facing reports and presentations.
  • Collaborating with internal teams to develop prediction models by correlating mine grade measurements or estimates with our sensor results to identify patterns, trends or other data features that relate to grade, texture, mineralogy, or lithology.
  • Working with the Field Service and Product Development team to further enhance our products and services through system data analysis and data quality assurance/control.
  • Determining and tracking data model accuracy and precision through comparison with sampled assay grades or grade estimates.
  • Reporting and presenting data results/trends to internal teams, as well as external clients.
  • Working closely with the Data team to create queries, scripts, and reports while ensuring data is well organized and maintained.
  • Building and maintaining good working relationships with our clients.
  • Promotes a positive company culture through sharing of information and supporting the learning and development of all colleagues.
  • Additional duties as occasionally required by your manager.



Qualifications


  • Degree in Earth Sciences (Geology, Geophysics), Geostatistics, Data Analytics, Mining Engineering or related field.
  • Ideally 1 to 4 years of relevant working experience, where experience in mining is preferred.
  • Experience performing statistical analysis or data science in a work setting is preferred.
  • Mining experience with in-grade control or working with ore control models is preferred.
  • Experience with data analysis tools such as Python or other statistical packages.
  • Experience and passion for solving analytical problems involving diverse data sets using quantitative approaches to generate insights.
  • Attention to detail and an interest in problem-solving.
  • Oral and written proficiency in English is required.
  • Additional oral and written proficiency in Spanish is an asset.
  • The ability to travel and support global offices is required (10-30%).
  • Legally able to work in Canada.


Salary Range: CAD 76000 - CAD 110000



The salary offered to the successful candidate will be based on their experience, knowledge and skills they bring to MineSense, market data based on their location as well as internal equity. Keeping this mind, the salary offered can be outside of the range posted. We are looking for talented folks at all levels, so please do not hesitate to apply.


Our total rewards package includes:

· A competitive bonus.

· Matching RRSP or 401K program (for Canadian and US employees)

· A comprehensive benefit program

· Transit Subsidy (for roles based in Vancouver, BC)

· Hybrid work (for roles that do not require to be onsite)

· 3 weeks' vacation or more depending on the position

· Company organized social events and celebrations to connect with your team

· Purpose-Driven: At MineSense, we don’t just clock in—we live our purpose. We’re on a mission to revolutionize the mining industry, and every day, we’re one step closer to a cleaner, greener world.

· Values That Resonate: Our core values—Innovation, Belonging, Resilience, and Adding Value—aren’t just buzzwords. They’re the bedrock of our culture. When you step into our team, you’re not just an employee; you’re a steward of these values.

· Impactful Work: Imagine contributing to a cleaner, more sustainable planet. At MineSense, you’re shaping the future of cleantech and developing cutting edge technology that literally hasn't been developed before. Your work matters, and it echoes beyond our walls.

· People-Centric: We’re not just about profits; we’re about people. Our organization cares deeply about its employees. When you join us, you become part of a community that supports growth, well-being, and success.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Why join us

Brex is the AI-powered spend platform. We help companies spend with confidence with integrated corporate cards, banking, and global payments, plus intuitive software for travel and expenses. Tens of thousands of companies from startups to enterprises — including DoorDash, Flexport, and Compass — use Brex to proactively control spend, reduce costs, and increase efficiency on a global scale.

Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.

Finance at Brex

The Finance team leads financial planning and analysis as well as corporate development, which includes board communications, investor relations, fundraising, and M&A. We strive to be agents of change rather than a reporting function. We’re integrated and partner closely with teams across Brex to evaluate key questions, solve problems, and drive results. Through our corporate development efforts, we are also deeply involved in long-term planning and major strategic decisions for the company.

What You’ll Do

As a Salesforce Business Systems Analyst, you’ll partner closely with internal teams, including Marketing, Sales, Revenue Operations, Customer Success, Support, and Finance, to bridge business needs with technical solutions. You will champion a data-driven culture, leveraging insights to ensure systems empower informed decision-making. Your focus will be on introducing new capabilities, change management, optimizing system efficiency, increasing adoption, and aligning technology with the company’s strategic goals.

Where you’ll work

This role will be based in our Vancouver office. You must be willing to work in office at least 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday, starting the week of January 6th, 2025. Employees will be able to work remotely for up to 4 weeks per year, for a minimum of one week at a time.

Responsibilities


Collaborate proactively with business stakeholders and internal system teams to deliver scalable and effective solutions - from concept to delivery
Design, document, and implement solutions in Salesforce Sales Cloud and related tools within the Go-to-Market (GTM) tech stack
Analyze existing business processes and systems, identifying opportunities for improvement
Partner with business stakeholders to simplify key metric reporting and ensure the accuracy of data across systems
Utilize data to generate insights that guide future business decisions and promote a data-driven culture throughout the organization
Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for solutions, ensuring they are well-documented for change management, enablement/training, and support


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent work experience)
3-5 years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst or in a similar role, with a focus on Salesforce (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud)
Proven experience working with cross-functional teams, particularly in Marketing, Sales, Revenue Operations, and Customer Success
Strong analytical skills to evaluate and improve complex business processes and systems
Expertise in data analysis, with the ability to handle large datasets, generate reports, and deliver actionable insights
In-depth knowledge of Salesforce architecture, data models, and integrations. Proficient in Salesforce administration tasks such as user management, security settings, and data management
Familiarity with third-party Salesforce applications/packages (LeanData, Gong, Outreach, ZoomInfo, Marketo) is a plus
Must be willing to work in office 2 days per week on Wednesday and Thursday


Compensation

The expected salary range for this role is $116,000 - $145,000 CAD. However, the starting base pay will depend on a number of factors including the candidate’s location, skills, experience, market demands, and internal pay parity. Depending on the position offered, equity and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package.

Please be aware, job-seekers may be at risk of targeting by malicious actors looking for personal data. Brex recruiters will only reach out via LinkedIn or email with a brex.com domain. Any outreach claiming to be from Brex via other sources should be ignored.
Show more
